column2: ENFJ Female Natalie Fe-Ni BP/S(C) MF Interviewed by ENFP Male
column3: Hello ENFJs! In this interview, I got a chance to talk to Natalie about what it's like to be an ENFJ Fe-Ni BP/S(C) MF. First, Natalie talked about her feminine Fe and double feminine NF blast. She described how it's different from an ESFJs blast. We also talked about the ENFJs fear of getting kicked out from the tribe if they don't help people. She said that they feel like if they get kicked out, they wouldn't know what to do with themselves to make them happy because of the Ti at the bottom. I also asked her what she thought her identity is with the NT sleep and she said that as an ENFJ, she gets her identity from being the wise guru who can solve all problems and have all answers. We also talked about SF play and how it can be both really stupid but also really useful. Natalie said that she is envious of ST play because they can explain work much better than SF play who just wants to party and play all day. During the interview, Natalie demonstrated her masculine Se as she chucked one of her cushions at her cat. Natalie also talked about how with her Se, she's always looking for the best. Best food, best clothes, best whatever. Natalie also talked about her masculine Ti and how she perceives herself as a threat, especially if she drops her M-Ti bomb on someone. I also asked Natalie why it's uncomfortable to ask people for directions or help. She told me that it's really irrational because she knows if someone asks her for help, she'd love to help that person and won't feel judgemental about it. Natalie said that as a decider, she feels like you should be more prepared with the double observing that you never need to ask for help from someone; otherwise, you come across as stupid. Watch this interview here:

I have dated an ENFJ male for 4 mths. He's really sweet, but he seems to be absent minded at times, like he has been possessed by his job. He is always "busy/stressed" and has no time for me (i only need to see him once a week. that's not a lot, right?)

Then he told me, "I have no time for you. I am very busy. I can only see you once in 2 weeks."

So I said in firm gentle and compassionate way, "Ok, let's take a braek from each other. BTW, i do know of your going out with other girls from the dating website."

Then for some reason, he opened up to me about his struggles with work and struggles to quit his addiction to going out with girls etc. It was such intimate sharing that I feel like we are even emotionally closer than before. His body language was very relaxed, affectionate and he held my hand very tightly and I felt very cherished. 

The next day, he told me, "I'm sorry that I hurt you."

The next time we met, we were supposed to be "friends" now and I felt like we are still having strong feelings for each other. Our behavior subtly shows that. He puts a hand protectively on my shoulder or on my knee despite that we were with my friends. He is very accomodating and gentlemanly. 

I'm wondering if he is commitment phobic and actually manipulated me to "breakup" or "take a break" from him.

i read that ENFJ's push people away even though they care for these people. Is this what he is doing? I dont understand his behavior. I feel he's sending me mixed signals.

column2: How do I stop my ENFJ self from feeling so down when my life is in a good place?
column3:
Hello fellow ENFJs 

I've been single since November and although I would never go back with my ESTP ex and I am in a very good place, I can't help but feel a massive gaping hole in my heart. 
I have my life well together for a 25 year old, I have a stable career, a few networks of friends, a loving albeit small family, a lovely flat in a nice area, tons of hobbies and things that could keep my busy - however without a relationship I feel like my life is stagnating. Nothing makes me happier than creating a deep bond with a SO, and building a normal happy life with someone - I finally thought I found that in my last relationship (although in hindsight I realised I gave way more than I received and would never go back to that...and the cheating). 

My friends tell me well "some of my best years have been when I was single" and although that may be true for them I just can't help but get in this weird depressive state where I feel like I can't be bothered to get out of bed or tidy up on some days unless I have an obligation to someone, however when I'm in a relationship I put in 110% in each day, I just want to give so badly, I just feel so empty when I'm not, things become somewhat meaningless to me. 

Currently I have a ISTJ that is keen on me and met me for a few dates via a friend, I decided we're best as friends now because there is obviously some cognitive differences (he comes across as robotic and rigid - however I very much admire his dutifulness and loyalty) and he has 0 interests outside of work so there's very little to talk about and I feel drained sometimes, conversations are very surface level. Saying that my parents are ENFJ + ISTJ and they have the best marriage I've ever known by becoming duals. 
Myself and a fellow ENFJ friend have recently become extremely close and slept together on a few occassions, we decided one day to start dating each other back in January but the next day he got cold feet as he himself had just come out of never ending relationships for the last 5 years and wanted some time alone and didn't want to ruin our friendship which is understandable. Myself and this ENFJ do get along so very well, we truly understand eachother, have same core values, humour, an exciting mix of spontanousness and dutifiulness that is hard to come by. 

Maybe I am still feeling the aftershock from the rollercoaster of my ex and the possibility of me and my ENFJ friend getting together which would be a match made in heaven, just the timing is wrong. I just feel so down and it's on my mind 24/7 for 4 months now, I just can't get any joy out of my hobbies or interests at the moment and I lose concentration at work so badly which I didn't before. I can't really date because I live in such an isolated area it's so hard to meet anyone.
I feel selfish for how horrible I feel about myself, many people are in way worse positions than me in their life (my neighbour is about to become homeless for example!) and they just get on with it and here I am getting depressed I don't have a partner ?? but really I just want to be on that path of building something with someone and I feel so stagnant without working on that as I have every other part of my life complete. Currently on the outside no one would know that I'm anything but a confident, warm and adventurous person who is living their best life but inside I feel so lost and empty and without purpose.  

Any other ENFJ perspectives on the situation would be so helpful - thank you all!!???•∞

Doing something extraordinary for an ENFJ - asking help lol

I think its essential I do it - as all other options have failed.. went to a psychologist, she had a panic attack hearing my situation.. worked myself out to some extent... in a phase of some radiance of clarity and regrouping my strengths to fight back.. Lets ur co-type - excel out of extraordinary circumstances

Hi,

Earlier this year I had somewhat of a breakdown, it was like a perfect combination of things all piled up and the house of cards came crashing down...the past, present and future all completely overwhelming me....when I feel like this I seem to get really stuck on everything that has ever hurt or upset me and I can be extremely cruel to myself, almost torturing myself...the way in which I can treat myself at times is not at all the way in which I would treat others...this is something I am really trying to work on; to be kind to myself.

One thing that has come up following this breakdown and trying to improve myself is the amount of trauma in my past and to some extent I had hidden a lot of my past from myself...not allowing myself to really experience feeling hurt and instead pushing everything deep down or creating a pleasant world inside my head to shield myself from reality (writing this makes me feel insane).

Is trauma, having trouble accepting/letting go of things and experiencing emotional problems intrinsic to ENFJ types?

I'm finding all of this really difficult and almost paralyzed by my emotions.

Thanks.

column2: Self-esteem issues and close friendships (the ENFJ)
column3:
Hello fellow ENFJs 

I've been taking a closer look at my inner-self and I'm realizing that a ton of my issues stem from low self-esteem. If I think about it there is no reason for me to not be confident in myself but its my natural tendency. Example: if a friend makes a skeptical face after I say something it affects me WAY more than it should. I'm wondering if it is common for ENFJs to suffer from low self-esteem, how other ENFJs have dealt with it, and if it has gotten better with age. 

Another quirk about me: I don't form extremely close relationships often. Over the course of my life I have had one "best" friend. (Best friend meaning someone I show my whole self to, someone I am completely comfortable with.) I think this might relate to me not being confident enough in myself to let people in. This is not to say I don't have any friends. I have tons of friends, and really good ones that trust me a lot; I just don't give my whole self to them. My second question: is this normal for ENFJs?

Thanks! Any comments about this or other ENFJ quirks are welcome!

I was talking to another ENFJ, and I was shocked to see how we both handle emotional pain and vulnerability. Both of us are very willing to talk about emotional pain and about times when we were weak or felt weak, but only after it happens and we feel fine again. In the moment, however, we both feel the need to hide our emotions, even from that small circle of people we love and trust.

For instance: I just got dumped by a guy. It really hurt. I have a lot of close friends I tell everything, but because I felt so ashamed (that I was dumped, that I missed him, that I was hurting and he wasn't, that I didn't see it coming), I didn't tell anyone pretty much anything and isolated myself until I felt better again. In general, I think I have a deep fear of being vulnerable (which affected the relationship with the guy in question). I won't ask for help when I really need it because I'm scared the fact that I need something from someone else will reveal something about me. Reveal what? I don't know.

I'm sure this goes far beyond MBTI and applies to all types to a certain extent, but I was also wondering if the nature of Fe might play into it a little. We're so used to masking our emotions and playing a role that it can be scary to be our genuine selves, even with people we love and trust the most. I know an INFP like this as well, except she never opens up haha. I at least talk about it once the emotions have passed.

Thoughts?

column2: How Fe Nx (ENFJ) uses all 8 Jungian Functions.
Am I the exception to the the INFP-ENFJ attraction rule?
column3:
I've had what I consider to be a weird interaction with an enfj and I'm looking for some insight or advice. I am an infp and from what I have been reading enfjs and infps are at best natural partners and soulmates and if nothing else generally get on very well and make for a great friendship.

I met this enfj socially and I felt a pull to him immediately, but couldn't figure out why and brushed it off as nothing. Eventually, we ended up having a one-on-one conversation and I can't describe the overwhelming spark that I felt in a pretty banal conversation. I had never and still to this day have never felt that with anyone in my life and I was overwhelmed and shocked by it. It was so strong that I actually had to look away and break the conversation because I felt that he could feel my energy or read how I felt (as ridiculous as that sounds), it was that powerful, for me anyway. 

Although I never went out of my way to talk to him or interact with him because he was in a relationship and I knew my feelings, we were part of an activity for several weeks it meant that we did have to come in contact. Even when we were not speaking to each other, but I ended up standing next to him or he sat next to me I felt this magnetic pull to him like I never experienced before in life. 

Anyway, I soon noticed that his interactions with me did not mirror his interactions with other people. When talking to everyone else he was his typical friendly, outgoing, charming enfj self and he would make it a point to be incredibly friendly with everyone and ask them questions about themselves and really get to know people, but when it came to me he was silent and awkward and never wanted to really engage in conversation with me. 

Even in a group setting if I would try to talk to him he seemed to be putting up some sort of barrier and when he would talk to me he wasn't as friendly or outgoing as he was with other people. Sometimes he even seemed cold or detached. The few times we would exchange messages I would be my normal infp funny self and he would barely respond and not really give anything. However, he would text up a storm with everyone else and became friends with them.

I guess my question is why? If infps and enfjs are supposed to be either this great love match or great friendship why was he at every imaginable turn blocking any kind of interaction we had or could have had? No, I was not expecting for us to fall in love and run away together as he had a girlfriend, but it is odd that we couldn't even be friends. 

When we would message and I would ask him questions about himself he would not give any insight about his life. At times he felt like he wanted to keep me at arm's length or did not like me at all. Is there something that I as an infp might have done to upset him that I didn't realize or is this just one of those situations where this particular enfj did not care for this particular infp? 

I remember this one time we were sitting next to each other and he got up to go do something and when he was finished instead of returning to his seat next to me he went and sat all the way on the other side of the room. It was things like that he would do that would leave me so confused. 

In group situations where I would watch him work the room and talk to everyone and get to know everyone it felt like he intentionally did not in any way want to engage me at all. Is that something enfjs do when someone has upset them? Do they go out of their way to exclude them? I guess I'm just trying to figure out what happened.

column2: Do ENFJ males struggle with women?
column3:
I know I do. I can never make any sense of it because I'm not bad looking or anything. I've become very obsessive about the way I look, but I don't have a negative self image. I carry myself rather highly, and dress and act accordingly usually. Regardless of this, I think my intellectually depressive attitude might turn women off. I like to talk about totally complex things and it seems that no women find that attractive. Over the years this has caused me to constantly wonder what people saw when they looked at me. I use to think that my ability to intellectually communicate would be a chick magnet but now I know better. I don't necessarily view it as a problem with me, though. In fact, I find myself attempting to "dumb myself down" to meet the standards of the women I'm attracted to. Furthermore, it seems that every time I give a women respect they immediately shut me out. It's like they don't want to be with me unless they constantly have to pursue my respect. As soon as I give a women any respect (which I usually believe they deserve) I'm fucked. Plus anytime I start to talk about my true beliefs or try to get into a deep convo with a woman they look at me like I'm an alien. I just don't get it, are women intimidated by intelligence, or just turned off by it, or what?

I know that was a long rant, and I know any guy at my age could go on for hours about women, but I just wanted to see if my fellow male ENFJs have similar issues or not.

I've arrived at the conclusion that I am an ENFJ after a long ass time, and the reason I struggled to realize this is because I was emulating other types in hopes that other people will like me more. In functional terms, my dominant Fe was compelling me to present as other types because I thought that's what people wanted me to be.

I remember certain scenarios in which people thought that my enthusiasm and empathy was inauthentic, like:
a) my high school friend telling me that it's weird how hard I laugh at all of her jokes
b) an acquaintance telling me my shocked gasp when I heard somebody she knew died was fake
c) my sister telling me that it doesn't matter that I say she's beautiful, because I always tell her that anyway.

Because of that, I learned how to be more argumentative and strongly disagree with people... sort of like a strong Fi user who prides himself on his individuality and doesn't care what others think. For example, when I don't like l how someone's outfit looks I tell them outright, not because I'm not aware of how it will hurt them, but because they will know that I'm being 100% real when I compliment them next time. 

That way, if they say my compliments are fake, I can reiterate by saying "Nuh-uh. You know damn well I'll call you out if I think you're doing something wrong. Remember X situation?" I became a strong-headed, brutally honest individual who doesn't need affirmation from anyone else. I learned how to be rude... so that they could take my kindness more seriously. 

I learned to tone down my Extroverted Feeling because of the negative associations that come with it (fake laughing, being overly friendly, looking weak by changing myself for other people)... which was an Extroverted Feeling motivation in and of itself.

There are many, many other examples of me imitating characteristics of other types, but I don't want to write 5 more paragraphs. I'm so sorry if this is confusing.

Can other EXFJs relate?

Here's a thread to post examples of fictional characters that you feel have been written to closely resemble the ENFJ archetype. 

I'll start with the most famous ENFJ of all.

Please add if you know any examples. I'll start with not quite ENFJ's.

When I was a kid, I loved the the 90's X-Men cartoon and it had a great example of an ENFJ Charles Xavier. Now, most see him as an INFJ which is probably true because he definitely doesn't give off that high energy of ENFJ's but the only problem is, no INFJ would actually take that kind of relentless initiative for their cause unless they've been put into the position already without any personal effort needing to be carried out. They just do it in their heads and if it comes up naturally and it doesn't take too much extraneous effort, they'll fight for what they believe in. ENFJ's on the other hand force what they know is good upon others and this is a good thing cos its force through kindness and empathy.

But then I guess you can say "what about Martin Luther King or Hitler" I make it sound like INFJ's are lazy but its not the case, they just have a different mode of being. But to really critique an INFJ properly, you just have to mirror them to INFP's. INFP's despite being introverted have unlimited will and energy and summoning knowingness from other dimensions and WANTING to integrate and manifest those things in actuality. The stereotype that INFP's are lazy comes from the very real phenomena of INFP's being overwhelmed by a flawed Te set up of society that makes them feel impossible for them to achieve and actualise or even be able to survive the world they are in. Then overthinking comes through the Se in the world which stimulates their Se and just constantly thinking about Se to the point it becomes debilitating. INFJ's choose to be lazy. Se is an immediate function, so to affect it takes no effort yet INFJ's still don't bother trying while Te takes generations to change in society because Te is codified law and mode of being in society.

Picard from ST next gen is also seen as an INTJ but I see his character as an amalgamation of INTJ and ENFJ. When he's being unhealthy and unlikeable, he's written as an INTJ, but in flow, the Te starts to sound like Fe. In the new show, he is fully an xNFJ. But its a terrible show.

column2: How bad can criticism affect ENFJ?
column3:
When I was younger I used to be extroverted. I will play with the other kids every day. 
I was the type that really liked to be praised so I did well in school and I was good at sports too. I was competitive with the boys too. With the other kids I will take the lead constantly and they seemed to like me. Sometimes with the adults I will be shy but I really wanted to impress everyone. But I wasn't the kind of mean girl from school, more like a girl who tries to be good at everything, doing my best. 

I was naive to think that people will like me for being like this. At some point (7th grade) they started talking bad about me, talk about my flaws, how I look. Said that I don't deserve my grades (their parents). It was a shock for me at that time. And this happened a lot from then on. In the begining I continued to be the same so I will get on their nerves but at some point I just didn't want the attention anymore. 

Because it always came with criticism and people pointing my flaws. 

When I was in kindergarden I will be so confident saying a poetry on mother's day at school and now at 23 yo I can't make a presentation. I just start talking, I see the people looking at me and all I can think about is:

They don't like me. If I do good they will talk bad about me. They are looking for every flaw they can find. 

And I lose my focus. 

On the inside I'm the same, at home I'm the same but with other people I will be quiet. I don't want people to say bad things about me. Most people will hate you for being better at something, will be jealous and I feel it and I don't like it. 

I'm wondering if others ENFJs went through something like this.

column2: ENFJ - The lukewarm and calculating empath !
column3:
Keirsey NF = 1 of 4 Empathic idealists with a huge concern for humanity's condition and bigger picture 
JCF Fe>Ni = Socially conforming empathic idealist  
MBTI ENFJ = Empathic Idealist [pedagogue of humanity] prone to being manipulated and being manipulative

No matter where I look, where I turn, the most common thing constantly spoken about ENFJ's is our idealistic / empathic natures. 

However, and here's the great divide in my opinion as far as the descriptions are concerned and the real experiences shared by people. 

Assuming that everyone has their ENFJ's typed right, no matter who posts in the forum, the 2 most common things they have to say about their ENFJ(s) are that ENFJ's are empathic and caring, or just as manipulative and controlling.  

Now ... one thing is pretty much clear, that regardless of how manipulative the ENFJ is - empathy, empathy and more empathy !!

However, considering the other side of the coin, I can't help but wonder just how ideally idealistic ENFJ's really are. What goes on in the mind of the ENFJ is a mystery that even I can't unlock ... 

What goes on in the mind of an ENFJ is a constant stream of thought about other people, humanity, the world - deep connections, immediate solutions to vast social problems - an optimistic hope that things will turn out for the better. But at the same time, this positive stream of thought is constantly countered by another which goes "What has the world done for me anyways?" and "Will what I do really make a difference?"

I wonder if this is a question that's mainly faced by the younger idealist than the elder ones. With the global situation deteriorating literally daily ... what sort of impact does that have on the mind of a young ENFJ who walks out the door and is exposed to death and fear? What impact does opening the TV have when images of death and destruction and disease are so rampant. So many of us empaths feel what others feel - sometimes I feel like I'm literally dying when I watch the TV now. 

So what's the new thought process? A lot of us have had to become much more objective in our views than we were inherently born to be. I wonder if that kind of growth is positive or negative ... or even if I should call it growth or de-evolution of the ENFJ archetype. 

I doubt that any ENFJ, at least here feels anything but a damning desire to lock up their empathy on a daily basis before stepping out into the world. I locked up mine for a good 5 or 6 years. How many ENFJ's have locked up theirs? How many walk around with metaphorical hoods over their heads and earplugs in their ears to drown out the misery of the real world. I know that I do ... and at times, the apathy that consumes my empathy fractures my soul in two as I have to realize that I have to walk through life with this hood. 

Anyways, as you all know, I've been critiquing the ENFJ archetype for several months now - and here's another critique - the idealized ENFJ may have been all those wonderful things as promised in these wonderful descriptions - but the modern day ENFJ can become an invisible shell of that former glory. 

The modern day ENFJ is exposed to a much larger scale of global misery than the ones preceding us [or at least that's how it feels to me - so apologies for a gross generalization], therefore a lot of tend to walk through life with blinders on ... calculating when and where and how to lock and unlock our empathy. In effect, becoming a relatively lukewarm and calculating empath. 

Fellow ENFJs ... feel free to share your experiences with regards to your experiences with empathy and how you calculate how much, or how little to feel empathy. In fact, can you even control it?

column3: ive heard this is a good match up andi m wondering if any of you enfjs have been with an intp, thoughts? what was it like? and on an entirely unrelated note, where does one find enfjs in the wild? asking for a friend.

Hello guys. This is going to be long so bear with me please hehe ^ I really need your help to understand this friend better!!!

I'm a female INTP who has a male ENFJ friend. We are good friends considering the fact we met online, known each other for 4 months, live in different continents, and have different religions, backgrounds and languages lol

We talk everyday, he initiates all the conversations almost all the time, I tend to have irregular sleeping pattern or work schedule so I try to reply as fast as I could but sometimes end up making him wait for hours and hours. He never complained of that tho so I don't really know how he feels about it. 

He says he enjoys our video calls so much, we talk about everything, and we talk at least once or twice a week for hours. most of the time it's usless stuff or me encouraging him to have more fun and be less uptight about certain things, or teaching him something or giving my two cents on situations that he asks about. He feels thankful I helped encourage him buy things he really wanted but had so much anxiety buying them and often calls me smart ot whatnot. Also I help him with his English since he's studying it academically now.

Here comes the part that I don't understand. So, sometimes due to internet connection the call would end abruptly, obviously I call back again since we were in the middle of a conversation but he never answers or replies, I don't push it too much I call twice and send a ghost emoji or gif and call it quits because I don't want to annoy him, then he takes forever to respond and never addresses what happened clearly.

Lately he would tell me if he had another call to wait or not wait for him to continue and it seemed such an upgrade from the "completely in the dark wait forever" situation, until today when I started challenging him in philosophical questions, I asked how do you know right from wrong and kept asking more about his answers, at first he said he enjoyed the mind stimulation but then I think I liked the debate and wanted more haha guilty but in a middle of an interesting idea the internet just cut me off, I called back and no answer, called again after 5 minutes and the same. I didn't understand so I assumed maybe he was overwhelmed with my questions and thought I was against him or something so I sent him a message saying " I'm a little sad that our conversation ended suddenly because it was so much fun and I was learning from him how to look at things differently and I'm going to sleep because I have work later. It's been two hours and he still didn't see or reply, this bothers me because I can't understand why he does it and I want your insight guys. Is this normal for you?

I'm really really dense, like no joke, I get things brilliantly sometimes and could be a useless rag other times, in this situation I feel like a rag. What am I missing? What is the wrong piece here?

I appreciate you reading this far, thank you haha

I have grown apart from one of my hometown friends, who is an ENFJ. We used to get along as kids because I think for the most part, few people out there are truly N, and she had a terrible home life (alcoholic mother / loud angry older brother) and I had no problem with her staying at my house most days in the summer because I honestly liked the effortless companionship. She was always interested in doing anything I wanted to do -- it was like my interests became her interests. And soon my other good friends became her friends -- she didn't have many friends at school, but I would invite her to things they would exclude her from, etc. Eventually she won most people over, as she had me. As we got older, I cared less and less about my "social" life, focusing more on academics, while her over the top energy and enthusiasm translated into being really active in our small town community, and befriending people from other towns etc. I was too shy to make that many new friends, but met lots of great people through her. To be clear -- she is one of the most social people I've ever met. Once we were older in high school I started to feel frustrated that she always put hanging out with virtual strangers above hanging out with what had become our core group of friends. I think it's because the rest of us were introverts, and just couldn't offer her the same level of excitement, etc. 

Long story short, we both started college, and it became even harder to maintain a deep / close friendship, and I felt myself somewhat mourning the loss of a friend. I would make so much effort to visit and see her, to make sure we didn't lose touch, but didn't receive the same in turn. She came back for the summer less and less, always with some new travel venture, internship, job abroad, etc. Meanwhile, I made great friends at college and had more than my share of friends from back home as well, so I was resigning myself to the idea that she and I were just growing apart. However I think she had never made deeper relationships with anyone else -- even after 4 years at college. In fact -- I'm honestly surprised that as social as she is, she graduated without anyone really close to her. I felt badly in fact. She was moving to NYC after graduation, and feeling lonely, so I introduced her to a few of my college friends. So she at least had people she knew. 

Shortly after graduation I cut the cord (nicely) -- I stopped putting all of the effort into the relationship that I had before, and as I expected it would, the friendship between us dwindled naturally -- however, as we were speaking less and less (not speaking at all tbh) I noticed that it seemed like she was very strongly clinging to the friends that I had introduced her to. Even now, I hear about what's going on in her life from my friends still living in NYC, than I do from her own mouth. 

TL;DR -- I wish my ENFJ friend, who did not seem to value our friendship, and who I have tried as nicely as possible to let go of, would respect my independence, instead of trying to get in with the social circles I have since formed apart from her. She is constantly showing up at events that I would like to enjoy like a best friend from college's birthday party, and will interrupt conversations I'm having with people at such events, to talk to THEM, not to me. That's actually the most common thing she does -- she sees me actually talking to someone, and she jumps in, pretending like we haven't had a huge falling out. It makes me really uncomfortable, and I wish she would just go away????? (Is that awful?) I just want to move on, and she makes it impossible by continuing to use my friends to force herself into my life. Once she sensed me backing away from an already pretty over friendship, this is when she began to do it, and I feel she began to do it even more the more I myself seemed to not want her around. I can think of no other reason than that she is doing this deliberately to antagonize me -- or to "win" my friends -- but that thought feels slightly paranoid, so I hope other ENFJs can shed light on what is occurring here.

I think she just doesn't handle rejection well. How can I talk to her that will make her feel less stung from my wanting to go separate ways. Any ENFJs with perspective? Please? I am very lost.

I hear a lot of talk about this pairing and see a lot of fledgling INFP-ENFJ relationships, but do they last?

Are you or do you know someone in a longterm INFP-ENFJ relationships (a few years or more)? Does it work?

And what are the enneagram types of the people in these relationships?

column2: Dear <Subject Inserted>, Sincerely <Personality Type> (Stolen from the INFJ'S)

Dear <Subject Inserted>, Sincerely <Personality Type> (Stolen from the INFJ'S)

Dear Friend,

One day though, you will understand. I promise. It will make sense. But for now, keep holding onto me. Don't let go. Soon. Just not today.

Sincerely Yours,
An ENFJ

column2: ENFJ and ENTP break up. Some help?
column3:
Hey everyone,

Basically to keep the story as short as possible.
I'm the ENFJ and he is an ENTP.

I'm not guessing the types we have both tested ourselves 

Our relationship began suddenly and out of the blue he chased me wanted me complimented me and we fell in love. I guess seeming out of character for that type I don't know.
Basically we were together for nearing 2 years before we broke up 2 weeks back.
A few weeks before I noticed there was some stress on our relationship, he's at a cross roads in his life about where to head and unsure of his future. (We're both studying for our degree's)

Throughout the relationship he's always been worried he never made me happy or couldn't make me happy and that I was sad all the time. This was frequently the basis of any talk we'd need to have. (We always agreed to talk situations out rather than just break up)
I'm currently undergoing CBT and had moderate depression and moderate anxiety however 5 days before we broke up my depression had been classified as mild. I'm also super sensitive to my emotions, I can cry but not be sad but instead just be overwhelmed by the situation if that makes any sense at all.
He said he needed space also which I respected, I could have done better than I did however I left him to his devices with his friends and did stuff I needed to do like go to the library go out with friends etc.
I went to his to stay for the weekend and we had a lovely weekend ( I didn't get upset at all, my work stress was over I'd finished uni for christmas).
I went out with friends night before he broke up with me and stopped by inbetween to say hi before I went out for some drinks, he kissed me etc I didn't think anything of this.
Then the the next morning he messaged me that he would meet me at mine later, I found this worrying but thought he wanted some quality time.

He broke up with me. I've been distraught ever since. I couldn't eat. Sleep. He said he loved me and he wanted to be friends but he couldn't give me what I needed and he had been trying to get back to how we were before. He said a break wouldn't work for us and we needed to break up as he needed space. He said he couldn't see a future with me.
He dropped my stuff off soon after and said he had nothing to say, he just repeated he was sorry and that he wanted to talk in the new year after christmas and we'll see what happens and that maybe in the future and then went home.
The big point is he cried when he was breaking up with me which is so out of character really.

I'm struggling to understand why. I may sound desperate but I'm not I'm just confused. I'm so in love with this man and fully want to stand by his side through anything and everything. But he's up and disappeared which I believe is a common trait when entp's get stressed out. We never spent any quality time together the past few months any time we spent together was with his friends. I think he just got bored :/ and to be honest he possibly noticed I was upset he didn't want to spend that quality time with me, we had talked about it previously and his lack of effort lately (his mind was tied up in other commitments) I understood this and just gave him time to do those things and when I was round bring him a cup of coffee how he liked it 

I've given him his space since he left however and only text merry christmas by including him in my group text.
I don't know what to do. I have no insight into how he's feeling and whether he does love me and want me.
I mean he said he loved me.

I'm just confused and would like some insight into what he might be thinking or what he thought.
He said he made the decision to break up on the morning he did it which to me seems really fast for quite a long relationship.

I've been hanging out with my friends a lot more over the christmas period and I have plans for new year keeping myself busy but I miss everything about him. He was my best friend and my lover and now he only wants one. I want to know if he does care and that by leaving him be I'm not pushing him away :/

Thank you for listening guys.

column2: ENFJ best friend and crush is confusing me.
column3:
Hello, I am an INFP (f) and one of my best friends/crush is an ENFJ (m). We've known each other for about a year through a common friend, but only started hanging out and then very quickly became close in the past 6 months or so. He has a girlfriend abroad whom he is in a long-distance relationship with, and they have had open relationships and breaks where they see other people before.
I'm personally really against making a move because he has a relationship, but I do still have feelings for him and keep wondering what he's about.

We usually see each other 4-5 times a week, sometimes alone, sometimes with a common friend group. I'm always the first he calls with good or bad news on work or other things. We both initiate conversations and hangouts. During the first 2 weeks of lockdown this year, he called me every evening before bedtime, sometimes to actually talk, sometimes with random things like to tell me he's hungry. I met all his family and friends. He invited me to come as his +2 to a wedding (I'll explain that later). One of our common friends told me once that when we hang out, he always directs everything he says at me. Another friend of mine asked if we were dating the first time she saw us together. Sometimes he seems to pull away and doesnt read or relpy to me for a day or two, but then sends a message like "Hello". When I don't reply for a couple of hours, he texts again or calls me. Although we were very close and talked about childhood stuff, future plans, etc, he never talked to me about his girlfriend until 1 month ago. When we go out, he usually already knows my usual orders for food and drinks and orders things for me, which is nice.
Those are all the things that make me think he likes me.

The things that confuse me are that he recently got an opportunity to go to the country where his gf will be. While he has known this for 2 months, he only mentioned the opportunity to me, but never mentioned his gf would be there too, no matter how many times we went over pro-con lists of staying or leaving. I found out during a coversation with another friend that the gf would move there too. Since then, he has been mentioning her more to me and tells me he's very happy about where he is in the relationship. But now, he has decided to not leave after all, eventhough he hasnt seen her in almost 2 years. And he's started telling me about other girls he used to date during their breaks, and how one of them has sent him a text, and it seemed like he was somewhat considering it. But when I asked more about what he wants, he just kinda stopped talking. We also have a common friend who used to have a crush on me (which enfj knows) but now has a gf. The three of us are really close-knit and enfj invites this person almost everywhere with us. If we have movie nights, he sits in the middle of us, we go see movies together, have dinners and drinks together at each others houses, and he was the other +2 invited to the wedding, etc.

What do you think, does this sound like he's just friendly? Or like he knows i have a crush and tries to keep distance because he doesn't want to affect the friendship? Or like he may have a crush too but tries to not act on it because he has a gf?

I'm at a point where I would be devastated if he left, but at least that would end the uncertainty. Now that he's staying, I'm just more confused.

column2: ENFJ - How To Use NT (Ni+Ti) Sleep
column3: Hello ENFJs! In this video, you will learn how to use NT Sleep if you have it in a demon state. NT Sleep is a combination of two functions which is Ni+Ti. Personality types that can have demon NT Sleep are ESTPs, ENFJs, ISTPs, and INFJs. Learning NT Sleep is important because it will help you create an effective plan for yourself. You will also learn how to take calculated risks and reap the rewards from them. In this video, you will learn specific examples on how to practice NT sleep and I provide examples for each of the four types as well as some universal application of this animal. Watch this video here:

Do you consider yourselves good listeners?

I know a number of very good ENFJs friends in real life and they all have something in common, they can talk for hours!! They seem to very often to launch into monologues, tell anecdotes, recall things that have happened to them, about their families, their friends, their experiences, their likes, dislikes etc. and not always be aware of monopolising conversations or not letting people talk. When they listen, and they are thoughtful and polite, and genuinely listen and care, sometimes it looks like it's just a polite little break until you give them a cue and they can start again. One of them will nicely ask me a question, I tell her something that is bothering me and she will again tell me in every detail how her friend has dealt, successfully, of course, with the same issue. At that point they are not very interested in a conversation, for example, asking have you tried this or that and how did it go, and have you thought of, or I think that will be good etc etc., no, it seems all they want to do is share their story, and you have to listen, even if it¬¥s not really relevant because you keep on mentioning why that wont work for you?

I know another man that used to email me the longest emails, send me photos, share his experiences, tell me his thoughts..etc. I used to reply very sparingly because I wasn't interested in the same manner and I didn't want to lead him on, rather the opposite, hope he would get the message I was reciprocating because I wasn't interested. But when he finally found out I was indeed no interested, he reacted with a lot of verbal aggression and felt utterly hurt of my rejection after all we had shared. I was astonished as I hadnt shared hardly anything, deliberately but he was telling me so much stuff he was oblivious I wasnt?

Is this a manifestation of Fe? Giving, means giving your experience as well? I have noticed a few other friends (sensors and nfs) get sometimes rather impatient with it, you can tell, and I sometimes struggle to pay attention too, as there is a lot repetition and detail and I do the typical NF thing of letting your eyes wander around the room and start thinking about my things. I really dont want to be impolite, hurt them by appearing uninterested in what they have to say, offend them or anything of the sort, I love these people, but Im concerned one day when Im a bit grumpy Im going to get really impatient and say use three words not 3 hundreddddd!!! lol. Also ive noticed some of my friends are feeling a bit alienated sometimes because there seems to be a bit of oneupmanship with one of them (you do x they have done it before, bigger and better, etc)..

Is this a typical trait, or my friends just happen to be this way? Any advice, would saying something be ok or really offensive and a no no? 

Also, how can you say No to an enfj without offending? Thanks but NO I dont want another drink, seriously im fine, no really, ook, hmm thanks..cheers..I honestly dont..ok..haha fine and then leave the drink untouched?

column2: If you?ôre feeling charitable please help this ENFP thank u
column3:
Hi ENFJs! An ENFP F here  Recently I had the pleasure of getting to know one of you and I would like to ask for some help discerning his attitude towards me (whether I?ôm just a friend to him or he views me as something more) because I CANT READ HIM AT ALL.. I?ôll try to keep it short and concise

Background:

Got to know him around 5months ago
I was secretly super wary of him because he seemed waaayy too nice and reminded me of people who I really dislike but I gave him the benefit of doubt
We don?ôt text but I got to know him better because I meet him coincidentally (on a weekly basis) & although I?ôm still quite wary of him, I feel like he generally has a good heart!

Reasons I?ôm overthinking:
1) He initiates physical contact/ likes to invade my personal space (touches my hand/shoulder etc + once, he was sitting beside me and put his foot at the bottom part of my barstool, the part where you can rest your leg at)
2) Gives me quite a lot of compliment (gave me a very sincere and warm-hearted compliment really early on whICH THREW ME FOR A LOOP, told me that I was ?úvery cute like a kid??and tells me that I make him laugh and brightens up his day EVERY TIME we converse)
3) Our other group mates told me that it was very obvious that he talks to me more in the group
4) He was unnecessarily nervous to talk about his past relationships (we were talking about it in our group)
5) Maintains very long eye contact with me when he speaks in the group
6) Both of us had an assignment due and although he was already done with it beforehand, he stayed back to help me with mine
7) Bought a pastry for me when he knew that I was staying back in school (he bought it when he was out of school but he had to come back to school for a certain project)
8) He replies almost instantly when I text him

Reasons why I think I?ôm overthinking:
1) I think he?ôs testing me because I mentioned I don?ôt like people who I don?ôt know invading my personal space and touching me without permission
2) He?ôs nice to everyone
3) I?ôve been told that I come off as genuine and weird by the rest so he probably thinks the same way and wants to just be a friend to this weirdo? HAHA
4) He helped his senior (a girl) to finish her report as well so I AINT SHIT REALLY...
5) Talks about treating food to other people as well but he never really does
6) Doesn?ôt initiate any text conversation with me

Honestly, I?ôm really just seeking clarity on this because I?ôm starting to feel pretty frustrated at this point. I wouldn?ôt say I?ôve developed a crush on him but this has been weighing on my mind for awhile now (that?ôs why I?ôve resorted to posting on this forum HAHAHAHAHAHAH). Any insights are welcome, thank you so so much

What are your favorite words of affirmation, compliments or words that have made you feel significant?
I?ôm an INFP and my partner is ENFJ, in the beginning of our relationship I gave him constant creative compliments but he always responded that I just had to say that because we were in a relationship and he really never believed me when I said he was special. I got so discouraged at being constantly shot down that I stopped saying as many nice things, but now he?ôs at a different place emotionally and really wants to hear affirming words from me. I?ôm naturally creative at describing my thoughts about him but since I?ôve become so discouraged, I need some help reviving my confidence.
I want to really make him feel confident, loved and significant, can you help me? What are examples of things people have said to you that you remember years later because it was so special?

Also, if you?ôve ever felt that way, where you don?ôt believe anything nice a romantic partner tells you, (even if you are willing to believe the same things from complete strangers) can you explain those feelings at all?

column2: How I get along with ENFJs as an INTJ
column3:
Hello folks,

This is part of a project I'm doing for myself, and in hopes that it's a positive contribution to the MBTI community. I hope my understanding of ENFJs cognitively speaking is fairly accurate.

The Mastermind & the Teacher

Thanks in the advance for the read! Feel free to comment.

Hey guys, 
as this is going to be my first post on this forum, I might as well make it interesting. roud:

Now, the situation is that I'm in love with an ENFJ. The problem for me is recognising if she feels the same. For the last 4 years we've been going into the same class. At first we couldn't stand each other, while I was an akward nerdy nerd, she was quite popular, kinda agressive and pretty talkative. The years went by, we both matured and 2 years later we became friends. Pretty much, we just flirted with each other and that was basically our whole communication, I started falling for her, but the feeling wasn't mutual at the time.  :sad:

After that we haven't seen each other for some time, it was summer break, so some 2-3 months. The school started again and I went sailing. Interestingly, she contacted me on my last night of sailing just to hear how I was and what I was doing, at the time I didn 't think much of that, cause she's an enfj afterall. lol. By the end of the next month we became much closer friends again. Our chit-chatting is still flerting, teasing each other, and competing to be the best we can be. Honestly, I think its done wonders for both of us.

This winter break we couldn't see each other for a month (we live quite far each from the other), and she contacted me before christmas eve, that continued later to us chatting once a week during the period. I honestly didn't believe I could survive without her at the time. She even asked me that upfront, and I told her  that I don't really know how I'm gonna get through without her. Later, when we finally saw each other, we talked about some stupid unimportant things and she coldly turned to her phone and re-entered the conversation with me only when there were more people. We used to go together from the school to the bus, and whenever we are left alone it would seem I take the whole talking while she's a lot more quieter. I was wondering if she just doesn't want to hang out with me, but she always wanted us to go together, and she did laugh at all the stupid things I said.

On facebook she puts a lot of love songs and I can't help it, but I believe those are all meant to me. I also noticed I'm the only guy which gets her likes there, like everywhere.  On one ocassion, I said her I was watching a movie called ?ûCatch me if you can?? she said she could't and put a lot of smiley faces. The next day, she hugged me. It was her way of saying she got me apparently.

Now, I don't know if this is important, but we stare into each others eyes often. Sometimes openly, with both of us doing the same for some time, just gazing into each others eyes (I believe our record is 4 min. and we only stoped it cause we had work to do at the time). Other times, I catch myself just wanting to look at her and see whats she doing, or just to look into that green fiery eyes, I might be deluding myself but I sometimes catch her doing the same thing. Whenever one of us needs some help, it would seem the other one comes out of its way to help. I think we both enjoy talking to each other about, well, anything, and just be given a chance to look into each other more.  

To conclude this, how do I know if she's interested in a relationship in me? Is she just being her normal enfj, or what? I believe this Monday, before the Valentine's day its my last train to catch her. Now, I do know she's in love, but I cant really gasp it if its arrowed towards me. She's flirty by nature and thats the thing confusing me most about her. I do notice sometimes we just seem to accidently touch, but I'm still quite insecure. Am I just being Captain Obvious here or? 

Oh, and thank you for reading all this, any kind of advice is mostly welcomed. I would realy enjoy if theres a way in which I could get to know if she's really interested or even how to approach her regarding this matter. I just know I don't want to lose her and want her to be happy. I know theres a love hurting her, and if thats cause of me, we're both crazy. No matter how different we are, it always comes down that, beneath it all, we are the same. Omg, I really do need to grow some fucking balls. We are both 18 and finishing high school, if it has any value.

column2: what do you think of an ISTP?
column3: ok so i keep getting the feeling that istp's are either hated or loved what do you guys think? any pastg experiances dealing with ISTPs?

Hi, guys. I've met one of you for the first time in my life. She's my coworker and we have a 15+ age difference, but she's the only other teacher I feel comfortable around. At first, I didn't think we'd be this close because she seemed to really like organization and things that are "proper", but now we talk about a lot of things. 

My question is this: I've recently started to wonder whether she was truly an ENFJ or not, because she loved recalling funny anecdotes about her family, and has a really good detailed memory about what happens here at the school, in a way I don't think I've ever seen someone with Se do. What do you guys think? Do I just have a wrong notion about your type?

column2: dating phase between male ENFJ and female ENFP - is he interested?
column3:
I recently met a male ENFJ at a party and I felt like we immediately bonded. We talked for hours even though there was a party going on and he ended up kissing me at the end of the night. We also had a conversation about drugs and he told me about one time he took mushrooms, how amazing it was, the deep connection he felt to himself and nature, then he proposed me to take it together one day. Like even for me as an ENFP I felt like this came quite fast, like you don't want to make experiences like this with everyone right?

The next day, he texted me and was really sweet, saying he would like to get to know me better and asked if I'd like to meet up soon. We met a few days later and we had the most romantic date ever. We both live in Paris and he took me to this rooftop with a view of whole Paris, took wine cheese and baguette with him (like come on, how French can someone be??) then we biked around the city, discovered some places and ended up in this cute little library where, guess what, there was a piano and he started playing... like... I didn't know dates like these exist outside of movies?•∫

I only had like 4 days left in Paris before going to Germany for about one month and even though he was really busy that week he assured me that we would see again before I'd leave. We saw each other two days before I left and I went at his place for the night. We immediately started making out but I just can not have sex with someone I barely know which he realized without me saying it so he stopped. The first couple of hours at his place felt kinda weird, I guess I wasn't really present and was overthinking the whole situation way too much... He then started asking me what kind of relationship I would like to have and told me that if I'm searching for affection/ sth. serious he wouldn't be the one and that he tries to focus on his career... (bad sign for an ENFJ I guess)

We talked about relationships in general and I opened up to him and told him a story that left some terrible scars on me and also is the reason why I can't just fuck around.. He was really understanding and sweet but when we got to talk about the relationships he had so far, he didn't want to get in detail. 

After that we made out for like an hour but only kissing and touching since he knew I didn't want to go further and it felt just sooo good. Even though we didn't have sex it felt so damn intimate and passionate and I'm pretty sure he felt so too. After that, he said to me that he prefers just having passion without sex over having it the other way round. 

So I'm confused, if he doesn't want to have something serious, why doesn't that bother him? (don't get me wrong, I think it's great that he thinks so but if he's neither looking for a relationship nor for sex, what's his goal then?)

I'm kinda afraid, he didn't enjoy the first few hours of that night because I really was a little awkward ( I have this huge problem where sometimes I'm just disconnecting in a situation, I'm still answering and everything but the conversations you can have with me just won't be that amazing since my mind is elsewhere...?•∫ I'm a weirdo) 

Do you think it's possible that he told me he wasn't interested in sth serious because in that moment he just thought I was boring or something but changed his mind afterwards? I know that ENFJs would not take excuses to get into a relationship with someone once they're head over heels in love which would mean that he's just not that interested but  it still felt as if there where other signals proving the opposite. Like the physical attraction between the two of us is really strong, I'm quite sure that he feels so too and also the next day he sent me a text hinting that we wants me to come back soon... 

What do you think ENFJs out there?

Thank you in advance and sorry for bothering you with all these details but they felt important and it's been bugging me for days??

Hey guys, I?ôve never posted on here but I have a question for enfj girls.
Is it normal for an enfj to disappear when they have intense feelings for someone? I just met an enfj girl and i really think we?ôre in love. I believe we are soul mates I really do. I?ôm also an infp male.
We met at this certain place unknowingly, but ever since I went up to talk to her, she hasn?ôt showed up there again. I can tell she was blown away when I approached her. I saw somewhere that when an enfj girl really likes someone she might get shy and try to hide it but I saw right through it when she did that. 
She was literally there almost every day passionately flirting with me for awhile (non verbally) and since I talked to her she hasn?ôt been there since. I am panicking because I am in love and I think she is too. It?ôs so painful for me that she just disappeared though. I can tell she really really is in love with me. I know people say love at first sight doesn?ôt exist, but I believe when you?ôre soul mates it does. The feeling I get from being around her is magical and I?ôve never felt it before. 
this is just so hard for me because I don?ôt have her contact info and she isn?ôt coming anymore. I do think she will come back eventually but what does this mean when an enfj girl behaves in this way?
Thank you so much for your answers. It will provide me great relief.

column2: Dysfunctional ENFJ - How do I realise my full potential?
column3:
I feel dysfunctional. I have been told I don't let go. This used to be a reasonably positive trait when I was working because I would keep at it until I found a solution, but apparently in a social situation it can be very annoying. Found advice on this forum about walking. Just today I decided I would try to walk regularly. I often do a 10k bike ride. There is a beautiful, calming walk near my house. 
Am I really an ENFJ? I remember being told I was something very unusual when I did the Myers-Briggs at work years ago. The tutor told me he was the same and always seemed to use a different route to get from a to b. I'm definitely dysfunctional.
My husband has just left me and I think the main reason is that I caused tension in the poker group. He is a pleaser and easily led. 
I remember as a kid I used to deliberately say something controversial so I could then charm anyone who didn't like my opinion out of their bad humour. Hmmmmm. Do I still do that? I think I still deliberately wind people up but now I choose people I don't like/ approve of or intend to be funny and don't quite hit the mark.

column2: Struggling to become a healthy ENFJ
column3:
Hi you all!

[my apologies for the long story but I think this amount of context is relevant for my question]

I am an ENFJ, and I have some serious concerns. I was hoping some of my fellow ENFJs could help me a little. I have been struggling for a long time, and would really like to become a healthy ENFJ instead of the unhealthy state (I think) I am in now.

For this I should probably add some information. I my early childhood I was raised by my parents not to be assertive at all. This caused me a lot of problems when I went to school. I used to be very outgoing, and made friends easily. If I remember correctly I understood from an early age how easily I could manipulate people, and feel how they felt. It was all quite innocent. 

Then at the age of 6 the bullying began. I took this all very personal and my parents told me to ignore it (probably the biggest fail ever). This continues to get worse and worse. And I became a very quiet kid that at one point stopped connecting with people. I "became" very introvert, and tried to focus on science and all things not involving too much human interaction. I had very dark thoughts about my life, followed an education way below my level, and started to behave really bad around the age of 13. 
Somehow I needed to be noticed, even if it resulted in a lot of negative attention. This did not get a lot better. My father was unable to advise me, never had a real connection, and he never had any real interest in me besides the usual name calling and telling me how bad I was. My mom got in a wheelchair, and I was required to pick up some of the chores, for which a was actually a bit too young. At this age I did not really have any real friends anymore and was completely isolated. This continued until around my 18th when I got really rebellious and started hanging out with the wrong types. 

Finally I dropped out of school, and next I moved on to a computer science education (again below my level but I didn't have any proper 'papers'). Finally with all these geeks and nerdy types the bullying stopped. I thought I was a similar type they were and believed that for years.

Now, almost 15 years later; I have been struggling with my identity like crazy. I have become very extroverted, I would like to presentations within communities relevant to my work, and I love training and educating my co-workers. I have a recent history with psychologists, and after they could not help me any further I found myself a personal coach.

This has helped me very very much to develop myself. However I still struggle with a few things and I have no clue how to fix them, how to improve myself. And FYI my girlfriend and I recently broke up from a 7 year relationship. And I mover to a new place where I don't know anyone.  

The two things I struggle with most. I am doing awful at scheduling and keeping friends. People like me, but I don't tend to follow up. I know what I want to do, but when something more fun comes along I am distracted and don't finish that thing I really wanted to do. I am at a point where I don't really want to bother going out anymore to meet new people. Well I actually but think no good will come of it. 

This is all really troubling to me, and I struggle to find a solution. Any advice, and tips would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks!

INTP here
Go ahead
Ravish me.

column2: How do you exploit your creativity while working from home during Covid?
column3: Dear ENFJs... bring me some valuable ideas!!!!

ENFJs: help!

My husband left me a few months ago and I was devastated. And this ENFJ's guy's girlfriend of many years cheated on him and left him last year. He was pretty torn up over it.

I met this ENFJ a couple years ago and we became fast friends, often flirting, even though I was with my husband and he was with his girlfriend.

A few months after my husband left me, I had sex with this ENFJ. I found out he had liked me since we first met. He also said he is very picky about who he has sex with and I am the first person he's been with since his gf left. Other things he has said: he is "scared" of me, he wants to have sex but doesn't want a relationship, he doesn't know what will happen between us but he really wants me to meet his mom and his family, and "why are you being so nice to me?"

So when this intimacy started a month ago, it moved very fast and we hung out a lot. He would call or email to hang out with his friends or at his house. Or he would just call because he missed me. 

I showed up once uninvited when I was in the neighborhood. But I thought this was okay because I had often done this throughout our friendship anyway (sometimes with my husband), to drop off cookies or chat. However, I don't know if I somehow crossed the line when I dropped by after we started having sex.

The last couple times I stayed over, he said it didn't matter if I stayed over or if we hung out. Then he seemed pretty cold when I left in the morning. He would open the door and just have this distance as I walked out. Now we haven't seen each other in about a week and a half. I finally texted him to ask how he was. He said he was annoyed at something, said it was a long story, and would tell me about it later. He asked how I was. I told him I was doing well and asked when we were going to hang out again (in a playful way). He didn't respond.

I'm confused. What happened? Why did we go from hanging out a lot to not seeing each other anymore?

The different Enneagram types have a very distinguishing effect on how ENFJs manifest their personalities.  Each Enneagram type creates a different type of ENFJ.  This is because each Enneagram type affects how the ENFJ uses their Fe.

First, let's define Fe.  At it's core, Fe is simply Feeling and Extraversion.




			Those who prefer feeling tend to come to decisions by associating or empathizing with the situation, looking at it 'from the inside' and weighing the situation to achieve, on balance, the greatest harmony, consensus and fit, considering the needs of the people involved.
		
Click to expand...





			Myers-Briggs literature uses the terms extraversion and introversion as Jung first used them, and preserves the original spelling of extraversion. Extraversion means "outward-turning" and introversion means "inward-turning."[17] These specific definitions vary somewhat from the popular usage of the words.

The preferences for extraversion and introversion are often called as attitudes. Briggs and Myers recognized that each of the cognitive functions can operate in the external world of behavior, action, people, and things (extraverted attitude) or the internal world of ideas and reflection (introverted attitude). The MBTI assessment sorts for an overall preference for one or the other.
		
Click to expand...

When we combine these factors, the result is something much more encompassing than the simple factor of ?úcaring about people?? which is honestly a misnomer based on the misinterpretation of the use of the word 'extroversion'.  Jung?ôs definition is spelled 'extraversion' to make the distinction between social attitude and mental perspective.  

The definition of Fe is much broader than that, and is more literally ?úFeeling based reasoning oriented outwardly??

That being the case, how each of us manifests our Fe is strongly influenced by our Enneagram type.  While MBTI type indicates perspective, Enneagram indicates our motivations.  For ENFJs, this means Enneagram type will flavor the focus of our Fe because our outward feelings are influenced by our motivations.

Type 1 ??In this type, Fe manifests most strongly as a sense of right and wrong, how things should be.  In this type, we see Fe?ôs drive to control the user?ôs environment and apply ideological truth more so than Fe?ôs desire to care about others.  Type 1 ENFJs are commonly 1w2.

Type 2 ??This is the most common type for ENFJs, and therefore it?ôs no surprise that with this type, Fe manifests as a care and concern for others.  Because this combination is so common, a lot of the standard description of ENFJs includes Enneagram Type 2 sensibilities.  If you?ôre a different Enneagram type, this will explain why some of the ENFJ description isn?ôt quite accurate for you.

Type 3 ??Fe manifests as a sense of how things should be, and creates the drive to make them so.  There is also an expectation of others??reaction, as well as a clear sense of where the individual should be socially.  Type 3 ENFJs are commonly 3w2.

Type 4 ??Fe manifests as a sense of how things should be both for the individual as well as their environment in a rather self oriented manner, insisting on aesthetics, conventions, and their unique tastes.   These ENFJs can be very elitist and feel very passionately about these things.  Type 4 ENFJs tend to have a notably strong Ni that can often confuse them with INFJs or INFPs.  

Type 5 ??These ENFJs are quite rare, but when they manifest as type 5s, these ENFJs feel very strongly about what they know to be correct and incorrect, as well as their need to be useful to the people they care about.  Type 5 ENFJs often have a strong Ti.

Type 6 ??These ENFJs manifest their Fe in a balanced mix of concern for others, their social status, security, loyalty, ideology, and their physical environment.  This is a less common Enneagram type for ENFJ, but is actually the most balanced use of Fe, focusing on everything Fe is used for rather evenly.

Type 7 ??Fe manifests itself in a whirlwind of care for others through the need for fun.  These ENFJs are the life of the party.  While other Type 7s can be very self serving in their pursuit of fun, excitement, and happiness, ENFJ 7s use their Fe to make sure everyone else is having fun too.  In a way, ENFJ 7s are much like lively 2s.

Type 8 ??These ENFJs primarily manifest Fe?ôs need for right and wrong and to control their environment because of a need for justice in an unjust world.  Fe?ôs sense of how things should be includes self sufficiency, strength of character, and independence, which can seem paradoxical to Fe?ôs standard definition.  ENFJ 8s almost always have a strong Se and are often 8w9s.

Type 9 ??Fe manifests as a desire for harmony in the environment through Fe?ôs sense of how things should be.  For an ENFJ 9, things should be harmonious.  Right and wrong, caring for others, and control of the environment are also important, but are secondary to the imperative for harmony.  ENFJ 9s are often 9w1s.

column3: Hello ENFJs! In this video, you will learn how to use Introverted Thinking (Ti), Extroverted Sensing (Se) and ST (Se+Ti) Consume for INFJs and ENFJs. This video will first define what Ti, Se, and ST consume are then I will also provide practical and easy to use examples on how to practice getting better at using these functions and animals. My goal here is to give INFJs and ENFJs a road map to help them practice their ST consume last and also working on their demon and 4th functions for maximum personal growth. Watch this video here:

So this enfj guy I like is on a mission for the church so essentially hes off limits, but I'm wondering if he even likes me. 

I had him talk to me into the we hours of the night, maybe midnight and i spill out my life story which i as an infj dont EVER do lol. And he says that it happens to him often lol I dont know what it was about him, but he made me want to spill my guts out and in the end he gave me the LONGEST most amazing 25-30second hug and kept telling me I was going to be okay. Whenever he looks at me it's almost like our eyes catch eachother and we cant look away but we do it in a way that I think keeps the other guessing. Long, but not long enough. He has an Adoring and intense gaze I guess I could say. 
He was always following me around when he was helping me pack the house up (we were helping move a lady) when the other missionaries were doing something else. He sang with me while we worked (I never do that fyi lol) and he was like a puppy dog with me.  My friend said I had him wrapped around my finger and that he did like me. Lol but still his reaction tonight made me wonder.

 So i essentially told him that i liked him over text since he lives so far away and of course he couldnt respond to it because hes a missionary and would get in trouble if he did, (and or he didnt respond because he didnt like me). But i said we could be just friends and he agreed. (But they're supposed to say that, since no romantic relationships are supposed to be happening on the mission) 
The next time I saw him at a family gathering, his family gathering I was invited to by his cousin, he almost pretended I wasnt there, he was kindof avoiding me and acting awkward. But he kept glancing my way, and I caught him a few times and he caught me a few times glancing as well. And when he was talking in front of the group his eyes kept locking on mine, and if he had even looked a split second longer people would have probably said "oOOooh"  (so he likes her!) Kind of thing. he went from mr. Chatty box to mr. Awkward avoidance with me. I kindof avoided him too, I was too scared of him.  Lol 
I was giving people hugs goodbye and planned on not giving mr enfj a hug but after I hugged someone else and turned away, he kindof nearly hesitantly opened walked towards me wanting to give me a hug. So I hugged him, but it was like a hug that made you think "boy he didnt really want to touch me" lol 
He quickly hugged me, and smiled then left. 

He would answer all of my texts and all of my voice texts before and after I had told him I liked him. 
He is very charming, handsome and kind. But I found out hes very talkative and enthusiastic with everyone. But it was like he talked to everyone but me, he did respond to a comment I said but not much else. I dont know what to do with this. He litterally made me think he hates me and thinks I'm gross because he avoided me lol. Idk. What do you think?

column2: Why does this ISTP like ENFJ's?
column3:

Hello ENFJ's. 
As an INFJ, I do find reading peoples motivations pretty easy, but I do have a blindspot when it comes to figuring out the intentions of ENFJ's, especially romantic intentions. I know you folk are massively friendly and can dazzle with your Fe, but unless its really spelled out for me, I'm damned if I can tell wether an ENFJ just likes me, or is being nice, or really 'likes' me, you know? My question is, do you as an ENFJ keep things deliberately vague until you decide to show your hand, or do you feel its just your natural state to have a somewhat fluid kind of friendliness/flirtation vibe going on most of the time? TIA. G. x
