column2: Releasing feelings through media or other external sources.
column3: I find that often I unintentionally hold on to my emotions or push them to the side especially when I feel like I need to take care of others. This leads to delaying grief/stress/etc. I find that when I watch or listen to emotional media like movies it acts like a pressure release valve. Do any other ENFJs struggle with dealing with their grief/stress/etc. in the moment? And do you find that external things like movies help you deal with it?

I am an INTJ, and my best friend is an ENFJ. We are very similar people in many respects (sense of humour, values etc) but we also very different in important ways. I believe that part of what attracts me to her is that she makes no sense to me. I struggle to understand her. I thought that perhaps other ENFJs could aid me in understanding her. 

- She says that she has lots of friends, but only two close friends. I am one of those two. Naturally, for me, you're either my friend or I am indifferent to you. I don't understand how she can distinguish in her mind between friend and close friend, nor how she could come to such conclusions. Similarly, I either miss you or I don't. If I miss someone, it is clear I miss them. I am not quite right without them. For example, we work together and I have no fun when she isn't there and I miss her. She claims to miss me, yet will go to work without me and have just as much fun. This doesn't make sense to me. 

- She never stops doing for people. Sometimes, she runs herself into the ground trying to help others, some who are utterly unimportant to her in my opinion. No matter how much I advise her to rest, take time for herself and stop giving so much of herself to others, she insists that she is fine and that I worry too much. Sometimes, she will help others at the cost of sacrificing time and energy that could be spent with those closest to her. Is this a common ENFJ trait? What motivates it? What is the logic behind it?

- Do ENFJs struggle to prioritise? While my friend never puts anything before her partner and children, I do sometimes feel like she puts too much effort into unimportant pursuits and people rather than the important people in her life (e.g. me and her best friend). 

- I often feel like she tells me things to make me feel better. I am a turbulent INTJ and, at the risk of getting too personal, I do suffer with some abandonment issues and low self esteem. She will often tell me that she loves me, that I am in her heart and that nothing could ever ruin our friendship even though her behaviour doesn't always support this. Is it common for ENFJs to lie to makes others feel better? Similarly, is it common for ENFJs to be more about words than actions? I am much more about actions obviously so I struggle when her actions don't logically follow what she says.

- Do ENFJs enjoy deep conversation? I often talk to her about ideas I have had or thoughts I have been mulling over and she seems genuinely interested. The conversation will end with her usually saying, "I definitely need to look into that when I get home" but is never spoken of again. 

- Do ENFJs bury themselves in others' problems to hide from their own or do they have a good grip on their internal world?

- Do ENFJs know what they want or are they too focused externally to truly know?

- How patient are ENFJs? She seems to have the patience of a saint. There are many times anyone else would have lost patience with me, but she still persists, and it doesn't always make sense to me. I wouldn't put up with as much as she does. 

- How loyal are ENFJs? Being so extroverted, I imagine it is hard for them to hold down friendships for very long and to be liable to flit from friendship to friendship. 

- Is absent-mindedness a common trait for ENFJs? I have lost count of how many times she has seen a text from me or her best friend, looked at it briefly, put her phone down to deal with something else and then not respond for hours. I often tell her to just reply immediately so she doesn't forget, but the message doesn't sink in.

- Is stubborn pride common for ENFJs?

- Is obsession common for ENFJs? She is very much unwilling to let people help her because, in her mind, they won't do it how she likes it and therefore it's just better that she does it herself. E.g. housework. 

- Are ENFJs are a good fit for an INTJ as a friend?

- As ENFJs yourselves, would you ever consider a friendship with an INTJ and why?

There may be more questions at a later point, but I cannot think of anymore at this time. 

Any help would be appreciated.

column2: Why are you guys so attractive?
column3:
I always found ENFJs appealing I don't know why. 
So recently I started getting close to an ENFJ guy and normally I don't really go head over heels for someone no matter how good they look or how nice they are but this is an exception. To be honest I can't even believe myself for being so attached to someone and I low-key hate myself for it (don't ask why). 

Any ENFJ guys want to give an ENTP fangirl some advice? Ladies you can chime in too. :heart:

I'm ENTP.  I have a good (ENFJ) friend who is wonderful in many ways and whom I have adored.  However, there's one issue.  I'm a fairly private person but, as we are close, I have shared things with ENFJ in confidence.  Some minor, some major.  

For the second time now, I have received questions from a mutual friend* of ours regarding things I've only told ENFJ.  The first time was more serious.  "How are things between you and your husband lately?  ENFJ said that you went on a date so it's getting better then?"  Things hadn't been good between my husband and I and it disturbed me that ENFJ would be talking to our friend about it.  I explained it away, brushed it off, as it was the first time something like that happened.  This was maybe a year ago, a little less.

Today was the second time.  "Hey how are you?  ENFJ said you had a job interview. How'd it go?"  Ok, well I didn't tell anyone about that because I wasn't sure I'd get the job and didn't want to have to explain the failure to everyone.  Also, as a stay-at-home mom who's marriage is in jeopardy, I was trying to restart my career, but didn't want to have to explain that either.

So there's a few things.  These quick questions from our friend don't tell me the context.  Why were they talking about me?  Was it just a quick fyi or were they discussing my marital problems?  Who knows?  Also, is there a restraint issue?  Like, I have this information but I just don't have the impulse control to keep it to myself?

Either way, I don't really feel like confronting her.  My style is to take stock internally of our relationship and say, well that relationship isn't what I thought it was and now I can only trust her so far or love her so much (as a friend).  I feel that even though she didn't divulge any serious secrets, I just can't trust her to keep things I tell her to herself.

So yes, at the end of all that is simply the question: Is this a common ENFJ trait?  Inability to keep a confidence?

---------
*I don't feel particularly close to this mutual friend.  At least, not as much so as ENFJ

column2: Super stressed ENFJ - I ended things to give him space, do you think he will return?
column3:
I'm an ENFP girl, and was seeing a ENFJ guy in a long distance exclusive dating relationship (not quite bf/gf). We met online and right from the start we connected really well. He showered me with affection and said a ton of sweet things, and we were calling each other every night. We would only get about 4-5 hours of sleep a night because we were both really busy people with multiple jobs and commitments. He would say things like "I'm addicted to you" and his actions showed it.

We met after about a month of talking, I flew to visit him. The weekend was magical and we got a long well in person too. We bonded both emotionally and physically and he said that there was nothing I could do that could make him not like me. 

A few days after I visited him, he went on a business trip and suddenly took days to respond to my messages. I gave him space since I didn't want to come off too clingy. After he returned from the trip, he grew more and more distant. I started wondering if he was no longer interested, or he was lying and had other girls or maybe got back with an ex. He would read my messages, but take 2-3 days to respond to them. His responses would all be "I'm sorry I've been missing.", "It's been really busy." and it became all apologies and reasons for his disappearance. He did have quite a lot going on his life - multiple businesses, dying relatives, major health issues, problems at his day job, unsupportive family... I wouldn't pressure for a response even though I was going crazy on my own, but I stayed positive and gave him supportive messages to cheer him up. 

I managed to schedule a call with him (I had to wait 3 days before he had some time) and he told me he still felt the same about me romantically, but he's been so stressed and busy that he wasn't able to even think about dating. I liked him a lot so I said I would wait for him, and I even surprised him by mailing him a care package.

A month later, the situation didn't show any signs of improvement, and he only got busier and busier. So a few days ago I managed to get a hold of him - it was difficult to find a time, but I was able to catch him between meetings so he called me from his car. 

I told him I liked him a lot and I felt an incredible connection with him. But it's been hard the last two months not hearing from him. He told me that things have been crazy for him and he hasn't even been able to see his friends, and he's actually eating meal replacement shakes since he doesn't even have time to eat anymore. He said he gets my messages but he's usually busy and unable to respond, and by the time he gets home he's too tired so he often forgets. He can't really organize his thoughts these days and he's been working at least 16 hours a day, 7 days a week. He said he still likes me and really appreciated how I handled the situation maturely and logically and gave him a lot of encouragement throughout. He feels bad that he can't do anything for me since he's been so busy, and that he doesn't know when his situation is going to improve.

I felt that even though I liked him a lot and it's a pity, the logical solution was for him to focus on himself and that it wasn't the right time for him to be dating. I didn't want to be a source of guilt for him, and it's long distance and he doesn't even know when he can see me next. It's not really a relationship when you aren't even communicating with each other. He doesn't want to let go of the exclusivity but he agrees that's the best approach. I told him that when he gets everything sorted out and if I'm still single, I would love to try again and that he would have to chase me back.

1. Do you think he's telling the truth? People say that if you like someone you will prioritize them no matter what - as an ENFJ under extreme stress would you ever forget your partner? 

2. Do you think he actually likes me, or he used this opportunity as an excuse to get out of the relationship?

3. Even though I told him I would like to date him again if we are both single when he's ready, I heard ENFJs move on fast. Do you think he will come back, or is it likely he would move on?

4. Should I keep checking in with him from time to time (even though we 'broke up'), or should I really give him space until he reaches out?

Thank you!!

I am ENFJ, but I sometimes have ENFP tendencies. I've been reading a lot on the functional stack and mbti more deeply, but I'm curious how others understand or see differences in just this one letter difference that makes ENFJ different from ENFP. I know the basics pretty well for each of the letters. I'm interested in what you have to share.

column2: Should I wait to see what he does now?
column3:
Hi, thanks for clicking. Before I start, I should mention that I'm thinking he's either an ENFJ or ESFJ. He got ENFJ on the actual test, though (even if I don't think the actual test means that much.) And sorry this is so long. I don't really know how to be brief with these things. ._. 

Anyway, we met back in April 2017. At the time, I didn't really care about anything/was messing around with any guy I thought was kind of interesting upon the first conversation, so pretty much the first chance I got, I had sex with him before getting to know him. We hung out multiple times after that, but it always ended in sex. Eventually, realizing I was actually into him but that he was expecting sex to be synonymous with us hanging out, I decided to keep my distance. And yes, I'm fully aware that's on me for having started things off the way I did. Regardless, I had wanted more and figured I couldn't GET more, so I backed off. 

FFWD 5-6 months. I hadn't contacted him at all. One night, though, I found myself wanting to mess around, and I wanted it to be with someone I knew. So I contacted him; I figured, since I knew that seemed to be all he wanted before, he'd be down this time. He was. After it happened, I felt sort of weird and decided that that was it for me for a while. He got really angry when I told him that, saying I used him as a piece of meat (which was obviously true, but since he had done that to me in the past, I figured he wouldn't mind being that himself. I hadn't done it to him to make him angry, just it seemed like we were on the same page.) So, we stopped talking AGAIN. 

FFWD to present day, 5-6 months after ^ . He messaged me out of the blue maybe 2 weeks ago. We talked like nothing happened, and he invited me to the movies. We went, had dinner, and then drove around before he took me to his place without telling me where we were going. Mind you right before we got there, he randomly told me he liked me and still cared about me (which now I'm thinking might have been a ploy to make me comfortable.) Upon getting to his house, we talked for a while about more random shit in the parking lot until he finally asks if I wanna come inside or go home. I told him I was trying to do it right this time, and that I felt like I should go home, but that I wasn't going anywhere soon and we could still hang out in the near future + just see where it went. He said he was cool with it and took me home. Once I got there, I did kiss him for a couple minutes, but then I went inside. 

That was about 5 days ago. Two days after it happened, I messaged him some stupid video I was watching. He didn't have much to say about it/it was barely a conversation. It's been 3 days since then, and he hasn't said anything else. I feel like I shouldn't say anything myself. Part of me thinks he did just want sex, and was too 'nice' to say so. That irritates me because if he had just been honest about what he wanted instead of taking me out and telling me he liked me and all that stuff first, something MIGHT have happened in his favor. The other part of me thinks maybe he just doesn't know what to say, but I'm doubting it for some reason.

Thoughts? Should I wait a few days and just ask him if sex was all he really wanted? I wouldn't snap at him if that were true, I'd just tell him that the dishonesty did hurt my feelings and that I think we might again need to have space, most likely for good since I'm actually moving out of state next summer anyway. Thank you, beforehand.

column2: One thing you love about your INFPs
column3: Hi, I am an INFP so this may be a bit of a narcissistic request but I would love to hear what different ENFJs love about their INFP friends or SOs. column2: Hello ENFJs! How can an ENFP girl go about seducing you guys?
column3:
I have had my sights set on an ENFJ male for a long time now and I would like to know. 

He is everything I have told myself I have to stay from (charismatic, seductive, natural leader, natural performer, hoard of followers male and female but mostly females, incredibly good looking, charming, genuinely caring, approachable in a nice I'll keep you at arms length kind of way, open except when it comes to himself, a little manipulative, etc.)

Even so, I find myself reluctantly drawn to him and it's an addictive feeling that is very hard to let go.

I'm a very direct person and I like to be straight to the point rather than beating around the bush. 
I have sent him a letter outright telling him that if he would let me, I want to be a source of support and comfort for him. I would like for him to depend on me and to not feel any loneliness.

If someone interested in you tells you that, would you be scared of/creeped out? How can I go about reeling you guys in to my charms?

column2: Help Communicating with an ENFJ friend?
column3:
Hi guys! I wanted to preface this by saying I love ENFJs and y'all are awesome!

Recently I made a friend who I am fairly certain is an ENFJ and she's a sweetie pie. We get along great and she's one of the most thoughtful friends I've ever had. The only problem is I think we have very different social needs and she has some mental issues that I'm not really good at dealing with. In a previous friendship with hers, she would hang out with her other friend constantly- almost 24/7, from what she's told me. She doesn't have much going on and I'm a student who's always running around, so when I do have free time I prefer to spend it with my boyfriend or alone; I maybe want to hang out once or twice every two weeks just because I'm so busy.

Is there a specific way you guys would prefer being turned down for hanging out? I feel bad for saying that I can't all the time, especially since I'm her only close friend.

column2: Where can I find an ENFJ of a specific variety?
column3:
Hi ENFJs :kitteh:

I am an INFP who has a weakness for ENFJs. I love helping other people and being helped with kindness, and I think you love being needed and helping others. I am kind, hate conflict, love emotional intelligence, and adore deep, intuitive conversations. With that said, I am convinced you are the most ideal type for me. My previous romantic interests have been an ENTJ (who mistyped himself as an ENFJ) and an INTP. Neither of these panned out very well due to the lack of emotional intelligence.

I know this question has been asked before, but I have been looking high and low for a male ENFJ who subscribes to the same beliefs/ideologies as myself (Muslim). I volunteer at good causes, at my university, at the mosque, and I have only come across two ENFJ men in my lifetime: one was Caucasian, the other was South-Asian Muslim but two years younger than me lol and didn't seem interested. Where can I find more ENFJs with similar beliefs and values as mine, and proceed to gain their romantic interest? Do you have any tips?

Love,
Your Admiring INFP, Girl Next Door roud:

column2: Male ENFJ's entourage of female friends
column3:
I've come across two male ENFJ's and both of them have a large host of female friends who use them as a confidante.
The girls probably think he's a nice, emotionally in touch boy who they can unload their problems onto and score one of those infamous ENFJ bear hugs.
He probably feels like Jesus on the mount, giving out invaluable advice and healing the blind, as well as upping his presumed desirability, even if the friendship is platonic.

Has anyone else noticed this?
Do you think it's a typical ENFJ thing?
As mentioned above, what is your IQ score, dear ENFJs?

column2: What do you ENFJs think of INTJs?
column3:

column3: If an ENFJ genuinely enjoys your company and feels comfortable around you would she be embarrassed about your failure, or is it that I did something to hurt her and she never let it be shown. Or am I just a fool who mistook her politeness for someone she works with as an actual blossoming friendship (it all changed once our environment changed). The question is why would an ENFJ stop being ENFJ like around someone and avoid the particular person and seem uneasy when they're around? Just an INTP missing his old friend ( it's been a few years)

column2: how do enfjs feel there own emotions?
column3:
i know that fe doms and aux,tend to feel others emotions and can even take on that emotions as there own.but how do you guys proccess your own feelings tawards people.
i read up on some online articles that enfjs tend to retionalize there internal states or emotions,or may not be awe of it,as fi is there 6th function.so they may have emotions and not be awe of it then has to let it out through there fe by speaking to someone
anyways how do you guys proccess your own emotions?

I have known two ENFJs and three ESFJs. All four of these people are around my age and know me fairly well. I have known two of the ESFJs about 2 years and they have both gone out of their way to get to know me better and talk to me. One of them was very interested in me and would try hard to get to know me to the point where they eventually asked "Does it bother you that I ask you so many questions?" The third ESFJ I have known for a few years and she often talks to me and asks what's going on in my life.

One of the ENFJs I have taken a few classes with in college but don't know super well, and the other I have known for a decade and know very well and see regularly. Both of these ENFJs have always been nice to me and seem to respect me, but have not tried to get to know me and will rarely start up a conversation with me or seem very excited to see me. The ENFJ that I know well will say hi to me and is very good about remembering little details about me and will compliment me, but doesn't seem too interested in getting to know me better and when she does talk to me it is sometimes just for the sake of conversation or to ask me to help her with something. She will occasionally try to include me in what she is doing, but other times will treat me as a stranger. Last month I saw her for the first time in 3 months and she barely said 2 words to me. She was very nice to me and didn't make me uncomfortable, but was distant.

Why do ENFJs not seem as interested in getting to know me? Is it because they know I am shy and don't want to make me uncomfortable by talking to me a lot? Let me know what other information I should provide.

I copied this from the INTP forum and edited it a little. This survey is meant for singles but if you are taken, feel free to answer :happy:
Credits @Eryngo

1. On a scale of 1-10 how committed are you to the idea of having a life partner? If 1 is "I'm hoping to die alone! Hooray!" and 10 is "OMG will this endless waiting ever be over? It's all I think about!"

2. If your answer ^^ is 2 or above, what kinds of life benefits do you think you have to offer your partner, as an ENFJ? Why should anyone bother with you?

3. (2 or above, again) Are there extra life benefits you offer that don't fit neatly into the ENFJ category?

4. (2 or above, again) Why are relationships worth the trouble, anyway? What's in it for you?

5. Are you an animal lover? (In the healthy way.) How would you feel if your partner had strong feelings about whether or not to have pets?

6. Kids. Is that negotiation on or off the table? If off, in what direction is it off? For or against?

7. Speaking of mating, scale of 1-10, what's your sex drive like? If 1 is African Elephant (every 2 to 4 years) and 10 is rabbit.

8. What's the last book you read? Was the genre indicative of your usual interest category? What was the book before that? What was the book before that?

9. How important is physical appearance to you? For yourself, and others.

10. Do you have values? Principles you hold dear? If so, what are they?

11. How important is your income in your life goals? Are you willing to shoulder the burden of income yourself, or is there a minimum you expect from your partner? (Keep in mind that in giving certain answers, you won't just be weeding out "freeloaders" you'll also lose the "starving artists." If, to you, this is the same thing, no problem.) 

12. Given your income requirements, if you want kids, how does the idea of one stay-at-home parent grab you? Would you like that parent to be you?

13. Put in order of lifestyle preference: City, Suburb, Country.

14. Do you have any dealbreakers regarding religion?

15. What gender are you? What gender is/are the partner(s) you have in mind for life partnering with?

16. Would you ever have a long-distance relationship? If so, how would you keep in touch? How long would you keep it this way before someone moved? Would you be open to moving for the right person?

17. What age range of humans would you consider having a long-term relationship with?

18. Relationship status: Single, Taken, Complicated

19. What is your outlook on society?

column2: A Bummed ENFJ is the Worst!
column3:
Hi, guys. maybe how I feel right now has to do with how tired I am.
I work at a school and had to be out the past 2 days doing some training. Well, today I get back, and one of the TAs tells
 me, "Your sub yesterday was awesome! She was really tough, not like..." 

and I completed the sentence for her, "Not too nice, like me?"

And the TA just embarrassingly smiled.
This TA is really old school and likes to yell at the kids, which is NOT my style. But still, this little interaction made me feel so upset. Am I too nice? Do I have too much patience? Do I need to up my game and be tough?
The kids do a great job and they do listen to me. 

I like to talk to each kid, getting down to their eye level, and walk the kid through what he or she did or said, and help them realize for themselves that they didn't make a good choice. 
This TA, she'll interrupt me in the middle of the kid's brainstorming and start yelling, "Ok, now go to the corner!" WTF. 
It is my class. I cannot believe people do that and expect effective results. Anyway, this interaction will see that I am internally pissed all day. Any suggestions/ comments/ thoughts?

Hi, i'm dealing with an istj mom and i've begun to despise her. Do you have any suggestions as to why? I feel like she's constantly on my back, even though I have good grades etc, etc, why do I always have to be perfect at everything!?!?!?! maybe i'm just being a typical teenager but i feel like i actually hate my parent

column2: Male ENFJs, signs they like you more than a friend
column3:
How do I know if this ENFJ likes me more than a friend? I know that ENFJs just like INFPs and ENFPs tend to be super friendly with everyone. 
So how do you act when you have a crush on someone? And how is it different from your usual friendliness? 


This a bit of TL;DR
We usually talk mostly about deep topics in person and also through texting. He always responds with long and thoughtful messages. We were once watching each other perform. I asked him if he was nervous. He said that he never gets nervous. I said "Yeah right, I saw that you were nervous!", he told me "OK, I was but only in front of you." (he was shy when he said this) I was just like "Ha ha ha, good joke, but I'm always nervous too", but he said that he never get nervous, only now. I didn't know what to say to that since I couldn't figure out if he was joking. We were texting for about a week when he told me that there's this one concert with our professor and that he hadn't seen it but had heard it's good and if I don't have anything to do that time, there's an option. He always responds to my messages and our conversation usually ends for a day or two if I'm the one not replying/asking a new question. There have even been times when I've read the message and haven't responded yet and he later writes something more. I once told him that I like how he responds to my messages and he said that he likes that I like it.  So the day came of the concert and he hadn't texted me and I thought that he'll flake out. So I asked him if we're going. And he replied with "Yes, of course!" But then he acted strange... He was like "How will I recognize you?" (there was this other time when I went to my lesson and opened the door and he was sitting inside the classroom, he told me "Oh, I didn't recognize you", even though we had met like two days ago and we've met several times...). I told him that I'll recognize him. And he said that we rarely see each other. Is he messing with me? Or can't he seriously remember what I look like (and he can see me social media profiles...)? Or he is trying to imply that we should see each other more often? We joked, smiled a lot, talked etc. Some things that could indicate interest - he touched me several times. He wrapped his hand around my waist to pull me ahead when we were walking out, he also touched my lower back several times to push me forward or guide me. There were also many accidental touchings. At one point he told me that I had large pupils (I've always had a bit larger pupils than normal since I was born but I don't use anything ) and he said that it's like instant attraction or something. He asked me what I like to eat a few times...? When we said goodbye he went in for a hug and I did a stupid thing - I patted him on the back.. it was a hug with a pat (hopefully he won't overanalyze this). He also thanked me for coming and said it was nice then corrected that the concert was nice.... Oh and there have been other times when he has scheduled his practice time right after mine (because he overheard when I have it) and came early in time when I come so he could see me. He didn't confess this to me but I thought it was pretty obvious. Why would you come that early? 
It feels like he likes me but then makes weird comments? And pretends he doesn't care that much?
so whats up between them???

What is the worst insult a person could say to you?
What are your worst fears?
What could someone do to really hurt you?
What is your biggest vulnerability?
What is the worst trait you could have/what is the worst possible light you could see yourself in?
What is the worst misconception someone could have about you?

Only found one thread on this topic back in 2012 so I thought I'd ask again. I'm an ENFP and I've been talking to an ENFJ guy for the last couple months, only to find out that we were attracted to each other. It hasn't been all that long and we're not jumping into anything but we discussed this today and it made me curious: is ENFP/ENFJ a good relationship dynamic?

As of now, we've been able to be very honest and candid with each other about our lives, the good and the bad. He stated that he feels like he can be himself around me and I feel the same. I love that he's so forthcoming with compliments and he's such a sweet person. He seems to like me for the same reason (according to him). We're also both huge dorks, so that definitely helps. I haven't really met an ENFJ guy before so it's kind of a new experience. Either way, we clicked very fast. I hope there's nothing hidden in that combination I'm unaware of but some of the reading I've done seems to indicate that it's a pretty good match.

That being said, I would love to know your thoughts on this. Again, we're not jumping into anything (we're still just friends as of now) but I'd like to know if there's anything to keep in mind.

Is that even possible?

From another perspective: 
Only say "yea", nods, smile, chuckle but rarely says his/her views. Doesn't ask follow up questions. Doesn't comment a word or anything. <<Doesn't seem to encourage the person ?! 

Not seem to be interested not disinterested. 

Possibly From an ENFJ perspective(My Own Guess):
I don't know what to say, but the person seems to have a point, and I don't want to disagree with it. It's his passion to talk about design, though I know nothing about design but why not let him speak more? Maybe he will tell me his story about design~ *Then nods, smiles, "yea", sometimes chuckle too. (idk why is chuckle but they do this)

The subject is too complex. They start to talk about the philosophy of design... I don't know what to response but, maybe I should at least try to engage indeed, just to show some respect to the person. 
Result - doesn't ask follow up questions but doesn't show any disinterest too. 

How does that sound?

column2: INTJs should die or more please
column3: Hi ENFJs i was pondering about what your relationships with INTJs (not necessarily romantic), do the words LOVE-HATE describe them well and if so why

Love letter to ENFJ - I need HELP!

Hi all,

I'm new to this forum even though I've been reading some threads for quite long. 

I'll try to make it short. I'm an INFP. I guess it comes as no surprise that I am currently in love with an ENFJ.  

Recently (a week ago) I gave my ENFJ a hand-written love letter where I confessed my feelings to him (because I could never do that in real life). By doing this, I wanted to know his answer on whether he is interested in me or not. So far I've received no reply from him. Complete silence. I don't know what to think or what to do now. We haven't met since then, but I could write him on Facebook whenever I wanted.

So, I'm really clueless now...does it mean he doesn't like me (in a romantic way), and avoids saying anything as not to hurt my feelings? If that's true than I don't get it...I wrote the letter specifically to know the TRUTH. I am prepared to hear what I don't want to hear and I wrote that it will be ok with time if that's the case. But this silence is killing me.

And actually I'm pretty damn sure he is in some way attracted to me since he plays the attraction by the book. (ENFJ crush/attraction signs threads here helped me to understand that). Unless I've overanalysed everything and only see what I want to see...

I know he might not be interested in a relationship now since he's super focused on his business, but that's why I wrote in the letter that I'm ready to wait as long as necessary and we don't need to jump straight into relationship. I just want to know if he likes me or not. 

Ugh, what shall I do now? I now kinda regret that I even wrote the letter...do you think it was a mistake? What could be reason he ignores me now when I pretty much demanded to know all the truth? Could it be he can't figure out his own feelings? Doesn't he realize that his silence hurts me a lot more than any kind of honest answer? 

How should I approach him now? Shall I text him or wait until we meet in real life and see how he acts?

I'm sorry for the rant, but I needed to spill it out somewhere, I guess that's why I registered here  

P.S. He's enneagram 3w2 if that changes anything.

column2: ENFJ male broke up with me (INFP) suddenly. Please help me understand his behaviour?
column3:
A mutual friend set me up with an ENFJ-A. At first I didn't like him, but he was sweet and said all the right things, and I began to like him a lot. 

During this period, he had his residency interviews (he was a doctor). I promised to wait until he was done so we could continue getting to know each other. He said to continue messaging him, and even if he was busy he would respond as soon as possible. True to his word, he always did. But I was usually the one initiating phone calls and texts. Yet, he was always sweet, flirty and assured me that he wanted to continue when I asked. He even told me very personal things about himself, such as about medical condition he has.

After he met me the first time, he said he had a good gut feeling. I began to fall for him. But I resisted certain values he tried to impart on me... For instance, a joint family system. I said I would do it, but I was scared of living with inlaws because it can lead to a lot of privacy concerns, especially since we are both South-Asian and abuse of daughter-in-laws is common in our culture. He told me he would protect me.

Towards the end of his interviews, he was excited to be done, video called me, liked my facebook posts, sounded so happy. And then he went to visit his parents. Before leaving his parents' place, he scheduled a phone conversation (included winky faces and sounded normal over text). 

He told me over phone that he had a bad gut feeling, but it was nice getting to know me. I was silent for a few seconds, couldn't speak. Then, he asked me a question about a spiritual practice (totally irrelevant). I don't know why he would do this. I am a spiritual person, but it wasn't right at a time like this. Then I said it was nice getting to know him too and goodbye. And he said "Goodbye?" and he sounded confused and hurt. What the hell. Can someone please explain to me this guy's behaviour.  Did he ever like me even?

column2: Is it possible to be an ENFJ that's not so fond of humanity?
column3:
So many of the ENFJ profiles I've read talk about the degree to which ENFJs love people/interacting with people and that's not really how I feel.  There are a small group of individuals for which I care deeply but humanity in general...eh, not so much. lol But that doesn't necessarily stop me from wanting to push people to be better--I'm fairly sure I'm an extrovert and gain energy from engaging the external world. 

I think I'm good with people, in that I understand them and know how to navigate them quite well, but it's not that I necessarily like dealing with them (lol or us), or even have any kind of optimism or sentimentality towards humanity en masse.  To be honest, I'm rather cynical about people and human nature and for as long as I can remember, have always been largely disenchanted with only sporadic bursts of idealism. I believe that we have it in us to be great, but not that we are innately so. And I feel inclined to help people reach their potential, but it drains the life out of me, to the extent that I question how much I actually like dealing with them...us.

Is this an odd sentiment for an ENFJ?

column2: Need help communicating with my ENFJ partner
column3:
Hello! I posted yesterday but I fear it was too tl;dr. So I'm asking again in summary form - any help is appreciated!

ENFP(f) dating ENFJ(m)

I would like advice on how to communicate with my ENFJ more effectively - having "talks" about problems seem to make things worse. How do I make you guys understand you're not failing us by not being perfect, and that it's okay to take care of your own needs first, and that saying no to something I want is *actually* fine?

Sometimes when he does things that make me sad I "talk" with him to understand why and make sure things are okay. He takes this as me being dissatisfied and that he is failing me when he can't change his behaviour even though I tell him it's okay, I love him regardless. He's also been neglecting his needs to fulfill expectations he seems to *think* I have of him (eg. seeing me almost every day, and when we are together he spends his whole time taking care of me - it's nice but def. not required). When I say it's okay if he needs time apart to do his own stuff, he says it's not fair to me for him to do that. This is now putting a strain on the relationship and does not feel sustainable.

I've been accomodating his habits and asking when he wants alone time - but we still see each other a lot and I can't tell when he says he wants to spend time with me whether he actually wants to now or if he feels obligated to and is still sacrificing for me.

column2: Advice Needed: What helps you cope with feelings when losing important friendships?
column3:
Hello fellow ENFJs,

I am a long time reader, first time post-er. And may I just say, reading through all of your experiences, and feelings, and methods of coping with different situations as an ENFJ really has helped me so much.

But I want to share my current situation with you, and get your thoughts. Three months ago I moved away from the city I've called home for 6 years, and back into my parent's home (for financial reasons).

It was a very emotional move, as I'd made many of what I perceived to be very good, strong, true friendships, and considered these people to be my chosen family. Like a true ENFJ, I would constantly be planning surprises to show I cared, going out of my way to comfort them if I they were sad, I was always the first to lend a hand and bring everyone together. Upon moving out of my apartment, I left all the amazing furniture and art work I'd collected over the past 6 years for my best friend, who I set up with the real estate to move into my apartment when I left (which was quite a lengthy process), as he had nothing of his own.

Now that I've left, obviously I'm no longer regularly seeing my friends - but they still have each other. The group of friends that I brought together is still going strong, but I no longer feel like I'm a part of anything. The communication is dwindling, I feel I'm being thought of less and less, whatever news in people's lives is being shared with me less and less. Which is currently the source of a great sadness for me, because I feel like I've been trying my utmost best to keep the friendships alive, but I get the feeling my friendship is not really much of a priority for anyone else.

And I know I should have expected this to happen, out of sight, out of mind, and none of my friends are ENFJ or really seem to pick up on how the sadness is affecting me. Unfortunately feeling this way has me acting out of character, and feeling very insecure and needy, and not like how I normally am at all.

This behaviour has started to slowly but more and more consistently manifest when I' communicating with my group of friends, even though I have been going to lengths to try and contain it. I start becoming passive aggressive at times, very insecure, and even  little cruel on one occasion when I'd been drinking.

Does anyone else have any advice on how I can cope with these feelings in a healthy way, instead of having them bleed out onto the people I care about? They haven't done anything wrong, but the sadness of missing them and not being physically around them can be overwhelming a times.

Thank you in advance for your help

Helloooo!!! I am an ENFP female who is very intrigued by an ENFJ male I met last week; we were conversing at a venue when we first met. We texted for the week and he invited me to a house party, then we conversed until the morning. Okay I'll place some info I feel relevant here:

- At the venue, his friend who I had just met said that he "doesn't often see him speaking to girls like that", like very one on one. Described him as "quite mysterious/cool".
- At the house party, his other friend who I had again only just met, said to me he "ooh must be interested" (without me provoking anything in the conversation hehehe) as he had only been invited earlier that night too.
- MAN there is like this electric exchange of attractive sexual energy towards one another so some things happened *wink* hahahhaa
- We are both naturally flirtatious (ENFs) but there was a HELLA lot of flirting
- Lots of cuddling and physical touch. Good conversations, regarding some strong opinions on general worldview, past relationships
- Weirdly comfortable around one another even though it was the first time we had properly spent time together.
- He pretty much took me to one side for the night for a one on one setting, but introduced me to his friends
- We spoke about our interactions in future tense, things like "we have plenty of time to get to know one another"
- He appeared to like tailoring himself in a certain way, being careful with how I viewed him (e.g. "I'm really trying not to come across that way!!")

I have - in recent times (due to getting hurt a little in my past relationship) - conditioned myself to feel indifferent to looking towards signals of reciprocity of interest because I now prefer that carefree, go with the flow kinda approach so as to minimise hurt, but with this guy.. eh, I don't know. ENFJ males seem to be complex, and alas, enigmatic boys are my kryptonite *faints*.

Ages ago I read a lot about feminine and masculine polarity. I just want to get to know someone and enjoy them, but I'm not the best at gauging when to initiate, when to wait for the other to make a move etc. All of this polarity stuff said that feminine energy means letting him initiate, ask you out, text first, and basically you must be the receiver. After the party, we both backed off and didn't text the next day (I think space for a guy is important). I decided to say a friendly hello the day after and the conversation is warm as usual. I'd like to see him again, so I'm just gonna wait and see. I'm so conflicted on the whole M/F polarity theory of masculine courting the feminine, and modern cultural norms of equal efforts.

I just have some- well, a lot- of questions about the ENFJ male....
- When you like someone, do you take on the role of pursuer & chaser or are you more concerned with being subtle/cool?
- Are you cautious about a new romantic interest or very overt with intentions?
- Do you send mixed signals?
- How would someone know that you're truly interested?
- Since you're very charming around everyone, how would you differ in your interactions with someone you had more interest in?
- Is it always a case of friends first with you guys?
- Should I wait for you to come to me in terms of initiating things?

Thank you in advance ~~~~ ENFJs are pretty awesome people.

column2: Dark thoughts and Alone time for ENFJ
column3:
Some ENFJ can turn to dark thoughts if they find themselves alone for too long. I wonder how many think this is the case for you. Do you start to think cynically and pessimistically about yourself or other people when you are alone. What do you think of?

I want to know if this is a result of high Ni coupled with high Fe. A tendency to stretch your observations about people and yourself and entertain sinister explanations for them and their reasons of behavior.

Secondly, going by ENFJ characteristics, there is a lot of thought into future plans. I know myself for sure always living in the future or the near future. Does this make you restless with activities you do when you are in the present. Is your enthusiastic optimism cause you to be bored and depressed with the here and now routines? For example, I decide im gonna start going to the gym cause i care about my body. I find myself putting more time in always planning for going than actually going into the gym. I'll do schedules, diets, workout programs, but find myself unable to follow the routine every other day.
How do ENFJs use Ne? Ne is the dominate function from NP though SJ use it as well. How does Ne manifest for ENFJ? ENFJ do use Ne as a sixth function.

Hello, hello, to my ENFJ friends! I desperately need your help! My friend (who I have no choice but to talk to) is an ENFJ. ISTJ - ENFJ friendships are often discouraged by personality charts, but I want to be friends with her. I find that talking to her is draining because we don°¶t have a lot in common and she won°¶t start conversation topics, but she stands next to me the entire time we°¶re together expecting me to come up with something to talk about that she°¶s interested in.

How can I be a good friend to an ENFJ, and what kinds of things should I talk with her about? Also, what things should I avoid / what annoys you about ISTJs?

I don°¶t care that I°¶m doing all the work in our friendship because I have no choice but to be in it, and I truly think she°¶s a good person, and I value our friendship. I°¶m worried I'll say the wrong thing and not know it, or at least not say the right thing. Please help me to avoid straining our friendship, I°¶d love to expand my horizons and befriend more of you lovely ENFJs!

Thanks!

column2: Is she really interested or just playing games?
column3:
Hi all,

I need your advice, whether I should continue seeing an ENFJ woman with a prospects of entering into a relationship one day or whether I should simply walk away. 

Here are the facts: I met her first probably less than a year ago but properly started to exchange messages and going out together about 4 months ago. She lives in NYC while I live in Dallas so we cannot see each other every day but so far we have spent maybe 3 full weeks together but we are calling and texting each other a lot. She is always very enthusiastic about me and said to me that I am the best. We have so much in common and have great chemistry. Before she met me she was in a longterm relationship with somebody with whom she broke up about a year ago. But internally is still quite attached to him and still message each other. Since we started going out things progressed quickly and we are regularly kissing (on public but not in front of friends) and we also had sex three times. However, on public we are just friends but I was introduced to her brother and parents (as friend). 

She also says that what comes next should be really long term and involve starting a family. I have no problems moving to NYC for her and starting family with her because I fell in love with her. I have also done lots of very good things for her and helped her out on so many occasions. As far as I know apart from the ex there is nobody else in the game.

The problem is that, everytime I ask her if she wants a proper relationship (or even think about having a relationship) she says that she needs time to get to know me and doesnt want to give any promisses. Apparently, she wants some time for herself and doesn't want a relationship at the moment. However, I feel like we have got to know each other quite well by know. Definitely knowing if we are a good fit or not (in my opinion though).

Is this normal behaviour for ENFJ not to enter relationship with somebody who she claims is the best because she wants time off (and risk loosing me or the spirit disappearing)?
Or do you think that she is only playing a game and ultimately will tell me lets just be friends?
Or is this genuine and she is into me but for some reason (pls tell me what) doesnt want to say Ok, I will have a relationship with you? Is it too short?

Thank you for any views and apologies for a long text

column2: My crush stopped responding suddenly.. what should I do?
column3:
Hello, so I'm an INFP female and I met this ENFJ guy on Tinder.. I fantasized about meeting someone with my ''theoretical ideal match type'' for a while now and it happened quite unexpectedly. It clicked immediately and I really thought I had found that deep connection I was craving for so long. We really texted a lot .. we could talk for 5-6 hours in a row, non-stop. In a 6-days time lapse we talked about teaching me guitar and piano, kids, marriage, buying a house, travel.... not mentioning how much we understood each other on the emotional and moral sides. He told me he really really like me, was very attracted to me, that I was on his mind and everything cheesy you can think about. It was surreal.

Then came the moment when we started talking about our love and sex history. At first he was chill and all and then a couple minutes later, he started telling me about how he could get really jealous and that even talking about the past gets him hurt and upset.. textually: ''I know it?ôs not right or fair because I wasn?ôt even around and you?ôre single so you can do what you want but it does get me jealous. This isn?ôt a thing where I?ôm saying don?ôt tell me. It?ôs a thing where I?ôm saying, I can get jealous and you should be aware of it cause I know I?ôve been really calm and chill with you but if I ever get angry, hurt or lash out.... you know why. I?ôm literally having a battle with the hulk in my head every time... and sometimes he wins'' ...

So I tried apologizing and he told me I have nothing to be sorry about, I did nothing wrong, it's his problem. I think I was also very understanding and supportive and showed no sign of being bothered by that.. the conversation still somewhat ended quickly but with the usual ''good night sweet dreams''. But then the day after, when I asked if he was feeling better, he just said not really, with no other words. Later that day I texted him again saying that this weakness doesn't stop me from wanting to be with him.. with no response yet more than 24 hours later. With fantastic Facebook messenger I can see that he saw my message. I can also see that he is not online as often... So now I'm really wondering what I should do.

With the Holidays around the corner I'm guessing maybe he has parties or family over, and got less time to be texting.. Or maybe he's just not wanting to go forward with me, I can't really tell. If it's got to be over then I really need closure, but I got a big whole nothing. No explanation, not even a simple ''please stop texting me''. Just plain ghosting. Should I wait? Is there any chance that he's gonna talk to me again, let's say after the holidays? If so then I don't want to spam and annoy him. But I also have a big urge to ask him to just tell me if he wants to cut contact... It's minimum respect I think... 

Please give me some advice!! :\

column2: How should we deal with aggressive ENTJ in work environment?
column3:
ENTJ is one of our closest cousins, yet there some of their personality traits are very different from ours.


ENFJ- dislikes conflict. ENTJ-sees conflict  as a fun, challenging intellectual game
ENFJ- enjoys the company of others and try to bring the best of them. ENTJ- loves the company of other people, particularly minions, henchmen  and the others they rule with efficiency
ENFJ- influences people with charisma. ENTJ- influences people with logic
In other words, every time we work hard to strive for harmony in a group, they will gladly to make it 'different'.

In my experience, I find that a very skilled ENTJ can easily spot our weakness: which is nurturing but quite protective to our personal boundaries at the same time. :sad:
 All they need to do to push our buttons are: giving the logic why we should share info on our personal life in front of others and then asking very sharp intelligent questions about it. 

My strategy was to disclose the information as vague as possible and then try to establish another topic. But it won't be easy if the group contains around 30-40% of their very dedicated friends.

Any other tips regarding to this?

column2: Relationship Advice ENFJ Type 3 / INFP Type 2 HELP!
column3:
Hey everyone! I?ôm a INFP type 2 (25F) and I REALLY like a ENFJ type 3 (23M). We live in different states but I?ôm moving to the same one in a few months for work. He is someone who takes on a lot of work to meet his goals which is something I admire about him, but it is proving challenging in getting time to speak with him. 

For a little background when we met it was 2 years ago at a bar. The connection was instant and I never felt something like it before. We locked eyes and it was very intense. I thought about it for weeks. We both however where in relationships at the time and we only talked briefly but friended each other on social media. We didn?ôt talk again until 8 months ago when we both were single and I decided to reach out. It progressed slowly and we would just primarily have short text conversations. I ended up being near where he lived for only one night 4 months ago and went to see him. We had a VERY strong connection but almost said no words to each other (which during the time made me feel like I was being too boring) but the connection was very obviously there. We ended up hooking up (which is very out of character for me) but it was honestly so amazing and the closeness was like something I?ôve never experienced.

Since then we continue to check in on one another ever since. We have told each other we like each other and flirted but it hasn?ôt progressed as much as I would think it would have. I know being physically present is important and he works a lot but I also feel like I?ôm putting more effort than he is. Sometimes I will text him and not get replied to for a day or couple days, usually with him apologizing and having an excuse. Or I will share something with him and not get a very long response. Reading more on ENFJs this seems like somewhat normal behavior but I have a hard time not feeling like he?ôs ?únot that into me??

So with all that said my few questions are

If a ENFJ is quiet around you is it a bad thing? When we were around others he was very playful but when we got time alone he was very quiet and I was nervous so I was very quiet which seemed almost awkward. He once in a while would do something like break into song or do something light but we didn?ôt have any kind of deep conversation. But we had a very strong physical connection.

Could it be that I?ôm reading it wrong and he isn?ôt interested in anything other than something sexual and is just still talking to me to be nice? He did say he missed me, often tells me I?ôm sweet and wanted to spend time together when I did get there but other times he will call me words like ?údude??and ?úpal??that make me ????

Because of how hot and cold he has been though I have also pulled back at times and waited for him to be the one to reach out to me. So I?ôm not sure if he?ôs doing it because he?ôs unsure of my feelings or what. I feel like it?ôs pretty obvious that I like him though. It seriously is messing with my head! Lol. 

We both still after all this time don?ôt know THAT much about each other, or at least not as much as I?ôd like. It?ôs still very surface level. Should I be the one to try to make the conversation deeper? I have found certain subjects when he is uncomfortable with them he will pass by them quickly. 

Should I give him more space and not be quick to respond if he does the same? I know reaching out to him to show him I care is important but I also don?ôt want to over burden or be ?útoo much??and not have any amount of mystery. 

Any kind or advice or insight would be appreciated, I have never liked someone in this way before and am very hopeful. Thank you so much!

column2: What do you do in alone time?
column3:
Is dancing, singing and talking to yourself considered normal ENFJ-alone at home-behavior? Or is that just crazy me? Honestly I mostly prefer that over playing video games, watching movies or whatever nowadays. Of course, I prefer being with people and/or being outside most of the time but I do want and need my alone time, but I spend even that in a kind of extroverted way lol.
How about yall?

column2: Help for a recently dumped ENFJ teen
column3:
I am actually asking for someone other than myself, out of my concern for him. A family member of mine just broke up with her ENFJ boyfriend of 3 1/2 years. She loves him, but they are 19 and she was feeling like she was married. He needs a lot of attention via the phone and texting throughout the day, and gets upset with her when he doesn't get it. His needs seems worse when she is under school stress.  And, there are other issues as well. He is good to her in most ways, but she was feeling like 'a well-fed bird in a cage'. So, she just broke up with him and he is just devastated.
Being an NF myself (she is an ENTJ), and having been on the same end of things as he now is, I am concerned for him. Any advice?? We NF's feel so deeply, these things are so hard. :sad:

column2: Dating a Guy with NO Baggage/ Pain - Help?
column3:
Long time no chat, ENFJs and onlookers. It's been a while, so I hope ya'll are doing alright!

I was hoping to get your opinions and insights, because... well, I have a problem that shouldn't seem like a problem at all. 

I'm an ENFJ (28-female) dating a male who I've tentatively typed as an ESFP. We were friends for a while before I was single again, and then I realized just how incredible he really was and he told me he liked me and we started dating. Things are going great, and I know he truly cares about me and loves me, too. I certainly see him as someone who I could be with for quite some time. We're both in a place in our lives where we're looking for someone who could be a life-partner, so we're both taking things seriously.

But here's the rub.

He has no... pain. I mean, kill me, right? He's just... whole. He's stable. He's confident, but not cocky. He's comfortable with who he is. He's been hurt in relationships, but he's gotten over them. He's just... okay all by himself. He doesn't need anything from anyone. He's happy on his own, but he's happier with me. 

I know what you're thinking. Well, damn, Steph, sounds like you found a real fuckin' keeper. What are you complaining about? He's hot, stable, confident, loves you, and you have really good chemistry. 

But my problem is-- I connect to others best through pain. 

My last two long term relationships were good relationships, and I was certainly in love before. In those relationships, I did what I did best, and it's something I think a lot of ENFJs do stunningly well-- take away other peoples pain through emotional comfort, shouldering or sharing burdens, and being there for them when the going gets really tough. I also really connect with others through being able to help them reach their goals, and encouraging them to push themselves. 

But... but he doesn't have that kind of pain. I'm not saying he's an innocent guy, 'cause he's absolutely not. He just... is so 'okay' with life. He claims he wasn't always this way, and that hiking the PCT in five months really changed him, but for the life of me, I don't know how in the fuck to deal with it. He's not worried about the future, he doesn't have any bad childhood baggage, his family is still together, he doesn't have any medical or mental issues, he's enjoying his life day-by-day without putting pressure on himself to get better-faster-stronger, he's just... he's so fucking 'okay'. And his goals consist of hiking more and buying a home in a few years.

And, ya'll, I'll tell you, I'm over here like, HEY ANXIETY, I'm feeling hella behind and lost in my life, I'm going back to school for another degree but unsure of it and really just want to make a difference and earn a good living and not have to work three jobs, I have a hard time relaxing, I have a mild martyr complex, I'm a writer, emotionally unstable (but not crazy at least), I journal about my problems, and get angry and emotional over things, and he's just cool as a fuckin' cucumber. And he's going to hike without me doing a damn thing to help him anyway. 

And I don't know how to help him. I don't know how to feel like I provide value. I mean, yeah, sure, I make him laugh, and we have chemistry, and we love each other, and companionship, and blah-blah-blah, but what is my PURPOSE in the relationship aside from to enjoy it? I need more DEPTH, I need more intimate connection, I need to get down there and scrape through him until I'm cuddled up against the marrow of his bones and understand every bit of who he is from his fears, to his flaws, to the secrets he's never let on. But he claims he just... is who he is, and that he's a simple guy and that's all there is to him.

I'm at a total loss. I don't know what role to play in the relationship, and I need one. I don't know what to do about it.

- - -

TLDR: I'm dating a man that has no emotional pain or baggage for me to help him through in order to connect, and I'm finding it hard to find my role as a value-provider in the relationship aside from just being a loving companion, which you can find in many people. How do you connect the deepest with your significant other, and have you ever been with someone who doesn't have pain? As ENFJs, I feel like we have an intimate relationship with sharing pain (hello, Fe), and not connecting through it is so strange to me.

i noticed that whenever people ask enfjs what they look for in a relastionship they always say,a connection or being authentic,now i get the feeling that enfjs are so obsessed with being authentic is because unconsiously they know they are superficial or people see them this way,maby there mode of thinking feels superficial even to themselfs,thats why enfjs are always on about ebing athentic and real?

As givers, do you ever have times where you feel like you are taken for granted by your friends, family, or loved ones?  The little things that you do every day for others...it is like some times people come to EXPECT that you will always be there, that you will always be the one to invite them to things or that you will always show up for them.

It is as though it doesn't even occur to the other people/other personality types that some times we need someone to give us things, to think about us and do things for us without being asked, that we need others to offer us a hug or try to make us smile or laugh just once, and that some times we need other people to be there for us.

It just crossed my mind just now that I've gone my entire life thinking of others, wanting to give to others, and a lot of people I've known have come to expect me to just accomodate them or give to them.  :sad:

column2: Sexual, fun and sensual experience with ENFJ?
column3:
Hi! I'm an INFP male from Norway :ball: (forgive my English), and after my past relationship im not ready to seek for a new one.. 

However, I really want to have sex with girls just for fun- I know this is not normal to think for INFPs but my view at it is different from before.. I plan to not letting anyone get hurt in the process! And I would also like to explore sexually with girls I like. 
Naturally, ENFJ girls is the type I love and could find at parties most likely, as I like to dance and is quite charming when I'm doing it. I also look very extroverted on the dance-floor even though I'm not.. 

I already got the snapchat from a girl I believe is ENFJ, but I dont know how to hook up with her.. and mby ENFJ girls really dont like sex just for sex? As an INFP I value deep connection, and I'm sure ENFJ does the same. At least this ENFJ I kissed at this party!  :couple_inlove: The thought of deep sensual connection I could have with her during sex makes me 
dream nowadays.. :violin:

is it possible for me to have a romantic night with her? after I tell my true intention ofc. I might even like her as a GF but I'm probably not pretty enough (heh she is hot). Also, I'm prepared for only sex anyway so I won't get sad if that's all I get (I'd be more than happy in fact).

I wonder if you people have any thoughts on this.. what should I do?
Should I seek other types that is more likely to hook up for sex? In that case I would have to hide my weird self on the parties.. I kinda want to be myself, but I can find it fun to use my actor side as well. However, I really really want to avoid pretending to be something else to get some fun sexual experiences. 

I wish for a kind spirit to help my thoughts <3 :anyone:

Would you rather chase someone romantically or have someone chase after you?

I find this interesting because talking with my ENFJ sister, she told me she gets insecure when someone pursues her. I, more or less, am indifferent or flattered by people chasing me but I never considered feeling insecure, so it came as a shock to me that she would feel that way.

So my question is, do you guys get insecure by this? If not, then what do you feel?

Hola dear ENFJs, I'm in desperate need of your insight. I'll be as brief and clear as possible (which for an Enfp is nearly impossible but I'll try my best !

I've met this enfj online and we only met in real life last week after talking every day for two months. To be honest I'm not even sure he's and enfj but he seemed to have Ni and Fe. He's a flirt but also incredibly warm, considerate and romantic. He was pretty serious about our potential relationship and much more open about his feelings than I was (I have a pretty strong Fi and struggle with expressing my emotions but he encouraged me to be more verbal) He kept saying he was impatient to meet me and he was sure our relationship would work out. His words reassured me but I wanted to see how it would be in real life before letting my feelings overwhelm me. When we finally met, we spent the whole day together and it was A-Mazing. At first he was more shy than I expected and he was looking away when I caught him looking at me but we still bonded immediately. We saw each other the next day, slept together and the chemistry was overwhelming. We both said we were happy to FINALLY be together and we couldn't stop touching each other.

Now you may be wondering what the problem is and why we didn't ride off into the sunset ?
Maybe a little backstory would help understanding better. One year ago he ended a 5 year long distance relationship, and even though he is over his ex girlfriend and they both agreed to break up, it hurt him a lot. The PROBLEM is, I live four hours away from him and I was only staying 4 days in his city. I said from the beggining that if we wasn't interested, there were many other women in his city he could talk to. But he kept talking to me. The last thing he said when we saw each other face to face was 'I want to see you again tomorrow' and the following night he texted me to say 'He really likes me but because we probably won't see each other again he wants to stop there to prevent himself from being hurt'. Of course I tried to reassure him and we talked a bit but then I said, 'I'll be in your town next month, you won't want to see me ?' which makes me sound emotionally manipulative and I bitterly regret it but I was so disappointed. I asked to see him and he never answered. I was cheated on by my ex boyfriend and I felt like I could move on thanks to this enfj and I'm sad he thinks he can't do the same. I sent him two other messages to tell him that he was worth the risk of being hurt again and if he meant everything he said to me I'm sure he can let of the past. 
I heard that when enfj decides something it's impossible to make them change their mind but I just can't give up on people suffering. I was selfishly wondering is he was waiting to see if I would insit to prove he was important to me. 
Is it that easy for enfj's to express romantic feelings for someone every day and suddenly ignore them ?  
I'm desperate to understand and possibly help him if I can.

(LITTLE DETAIL THAT I'M SURELY OVERANALYZING) the night he 'dumped me' he conveniently took many snapchats of him having fun at a party. So either he moves on reaaaaally quickly, either that's what he wants to show. Also, I put something in my story and he watched it , so at least he acknowledges my existence.) Sorry for venting guys. BTW my amazing best friend is an enfj so even though I don't sound like it I LOVE YOU.

Hey guys! On this site I've read your personality type is 'strongly linked to Narcissistic personality'. Keeping in mind that you're Fe-doms (and that many of you are Twos in Enneagram), it can be shocking to some, and definitely is to me. My ENFJ friend claims he's got NPD and his psychiatrist also assumed that, but he stopped seeing her before she diagnosed him eventually. Either way, what made him almost completely sure that he's a narcissist, was this list of traits. Almost everything was spot on in his case.

So now my questions are:
1) What are your thoughts on the topic? Have you ever suspected yourself to be a narcissist or have you heard from other people that you act like one?
2) To people who know at least one ENFJ - would you say that they do posses traits mentioned in the page above? I wonder how strongly NPD really is linked to this personality type.

Feel free to share your opinion, whoever you are.

Just curious, but how does your tertiary function manifest in accordance with your other functions - or isolated from your other functions (to an extent)? What about your inferior function? Also do you actively work on developing your tertiary or inferior functions, if so how? Do you try to incorporate them with your leading functions too?

column2: Want to be Interviewed about your Type on Youtube?
column3:

Jetplane48 here and I just wanted to know if you guys would join our growing Personality Page on Facebook where we discuss MBTI/Socionics/Enneagram etc similar areas of psychology including disorders and abnormalities relating to personality (maybe even astrology?) and thanks for joining


And Yes, I do have a Youtube account discussing MBTI and similar systems. Here it is: https://www.youtube.com/user/jetplane48


Hello ENFPs, I am an ESTP and I'm looking to interview you! I really want to get to know your type via this interactions. I have a a bunch of other videos up but these are they usually turn out:
